X3ci5vZ3ksc_S0-4FnwHJg.text: Im so glad that Makers and Finders has found it's way to Downtown Summerlin! We got here and it was packed so we opted to sit outside which is a cute little patio with a few tables and a view of some shops. We were greeted immediately and I ordered an iced chai latte. I am a huge critic of chai lattes and this drink here made it to my top 5, it's amazing! There is so much to chose from on the menu to eat. I love that it has a latin twist to their food. I had ordered the bagel with bacon and eggs with has browns. It was simple and I enjoyed it. The service was prompt and they were friendly. We will back back to try other menu items .

Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U1oHUw0zfb2R5nlpWdriVA.text: Home brewed black iced tea makes everything better. Linda was super helpful in making recommendations. Definitely will be coming back for this again.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

u6xIS3_Cpd9eN-tFcowyTQ.text: First impression was this place has a lot of potential with quite a variety of items for breakfast and lunch. The only reason I gave it 4 stars and not 5 is there was a wait for tables, yet 4 tables had been vacated but there was no buser to clean said tables.  The hostess at the front appeared to be bored.  Once we were seated on the patio we had a lovely brunch.  I forgot our servers name but she had a cute personality and was helpful with suggestions.

DCPGem0TRXY-WCcwacBVbg.text: "Meh" is too generous.  Tried yesterday with family and hit the place at about 10AM.  Initial impression was this place was being operated by young, snobby millennials who care more about the crap they are playing over the sound system than their customers.  Took several requests to serve my daughter's juice and more to get my other daughter's side of potatoes. When I asked where they were, no apology, just "order is on the way".  Chef/Cooks can't handle the menu, which is far too complex to be run by amateurs. My benedict had one hard yolk (not run whatsoever) and one that was also over, but not hard.  Bacon was served raw and was addressed by manager as "here is your 'crispy' bacon".  No, sir, you served me RAW PORK.  Potatoes finally arrive and they are under cooked.  Shocker.   2 stars because my food was good, but nobody else cared for theirs.  Will not be returning.  Far too many options in the area that are superior in service, atmosphere and value.

qdOeLilEq3uaI-v7kylfKg.text: I heard about "Makers & Finders Coffee" a long time ago, and how it was some where downtown. It was quite the drive for me, so I never found time to actually go and find it.   The other location is located somewhere in the arts district.  I even heard some people call it a "hidden gem"  So when I found out they were opening a new location at Downtown Summerlin I just couldn't wait!  Seated right away, I noticed the interior was very clean which is a must for me.  Being a barista, strong coffee is always preferred so when I tried their expresso I fell in love right away.  Will be back, probably with shopping bags in my hand hehe

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

E-QgNxHzCl3OW39n2_ftnQ.text: They sat all six of us at a table meant for 4 at the most. We were all so squished and honestly stunned that they would sit us there. We have the place another chance. We came with Family of 8 and once again we were sat at a small table meant for at most 6. We were all super smashed and could barely fit any dishes on the table. Our legs were constantly touching each other. Our pregnant mom was forced to sit in the sun on mother's day We asked for a different table and our server didn't even ask to see if we could have the table. After that a family of 4 sat at the table meant for 8!! If it weren't for the good food we would've left the place.

hF9LdDivPfFwAUYkp38NrA.text: I've gone here multiple times and each time I have been underwhelmed by not only the food but the service. It seems to be decently packed throughout the week but especially busy during the weekends because people find it to be a nice brunch place. As I mentioned in my review of their original location, it's Latin inspired breakfast-lunch items, however, many of the dishes that I have gotten at this location have been underwhelming sometimes in flavor, other times in presentation. The coffee is ok, the specialty lattes can be overly sweet and lacks the True coffee flavor that should be prominent, also it's on the expensive side ($5 and up). Service is always slow and leaves you wondering whether they forgot about you. Unfortunately I must say, go to the other location that's downtown...you'll be way more satisfied.

pzZQ3rBDgElMN4yUTG7iqg.text: Ordered takeout from here. Had the steak salad. So good. Close to work. May have to try other dishes too. My coworker ordered the chicken and it smelled good in the office.

WC49Jn-3iQ7heaXJY8snmQ.text: Makers & Finders was recommended to me by one of gyms trainers. She told me of lavender infused lattes and vegan brunch options. What I pictured in my head was a hipster coffee bar and I wasn't wrong.   I'm personally attracted to the wool knitted hat, beards, round glasses kind of scene and this place was full of it. We enter and stand awkwardly waiting to be seated. After a couple minutes a nice girl seats us.   She gives us menus with an extensive choice of coffees and brunch options. I ordered a sea salt caramel latte and my friend ordered a honey almond latte. The drinks upon arrival looked amazing. When I first sipped it I was amazed with the taste and my friends drink was tasty as well. I only managed to get through about half of my latte, the salt content eventually became too much and I couldn't continue with it.   Very trendy place with awesome atmosphere. The menu is extensive enough for you to find something you'll like. For the same price as Starbucks with a trendier vibe why not give it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nm2LiazG63lQrqhLjPJjdw.text: The wait is was to long the service is awful. The hostess was extremely rude. We waited over an hour for our food. The waiter said the kitchen messed up when we see other people food coming out after we have sat down

hqzv-an-A9vrIgGbwyPmag.text: I would love to comment on the food... but after a 1.5 hour wait (that was originally a 35 minute expected wait time), my party was told the kitchen was so backed up that even if we were seated, we wouldn't eat for another hour. If the culture of this establishment was friendly, I could try to understand the back up in the kitchen. However, every host we dealt with was incredulous and snappy, acting like we were less than them. Unfortunately, no matter how good the food or drink is touted to be, it is tainted by the pretentiousness of the staff. In a friendly town that prides itself on hospitality; this place thrives on its "we dont give a shit" vibe.

30wrfEFqdEGdBKYRWqkXUQ.text: Update 8/11/2018  It's been a few months and they seem to have gotten into their groove... great service to go along with their great coffee.  Very happy I finally made it back in to try since their rough opening.   -----------------------------------------------  It's finally here... and 30 minutes closer to my house!  Same great menu and drinks as the arts district location.  If you've been to the original, just trade the hipsters for the Summerlin set.  Now... I'm willing to give this place the benefit of doubt since it recently opened and maybe they haven't hit their stride... but the experience was not nearly as good as at their phenomenal original location.   Went on a Sunday afternoon and the place  was bursting at the seams... the service was completely overwhelmed.  The service was slow, confused and the food quality was not the best.    I'll give them another try ... maybe in a few weeks.  Hopefully they will have gotten their groove and be as good as their original location.  Till then...

mg3KtVUaPOQ_42HThFgvBg.text: I tried this place a couple times and I did enjoy it.  The food was pretty good, the benedicts I liked a lot, especially since they are gluten free!  But....unfortunately for me, I won't be back due to service.   Or lack thereof.  We hardly saw our server.  No checking on us after we got our food.  Literally came over to just drop off the check and at that point.... very antsy for us to pay.  The last time I tried to go, the hostess acted like it was such a bother to seat us and nobody came to our table.  At that point, we went across the street to SkinnyFats and enjoyed our meal.   P.S. I am a good customer.... but even if I wasn't, they don't need to act like that.  So disappointing because I really wanted to like this place!  P.S. The two stars are only because the food was good.

ZbjzzA_sTAJcMhrCWK2vXg.text: This is probably the worst coffee shop I've ever been to and I would not recommend it to anyone.   The GOOD:  1) Great service 2) Very aesthetically pleasing; cute place to take photos   The BAD: 1) Super expensive!! I've been to plenty of coffee shops and brunch places in NY/SF and this is probably one of the most expensive places I've ever been to. With tax and tip, my drink alone came out to be around $8.  2) My drink was horrible, and the food was just alright. I ordered an iced matcha green tea latte, and it was literally just milk, ice, and the tiniest bit of matcha. It was the worst drink I've ever had in my life, and it was so expensive.  3) The food was just okay - nothing really horrible but also nothing really great, either. Would not recommend to anyone.

cTynHjeGXvFdYLNUpR3ahg.text: Visited the one Downtown & was very excited that they were opening one close in my area (Summerlin). However I wasn't too impressed with this location. Walked in and wasn't greeted or assisted properly, the hostess saw me waiting to put my name on the list but didn't even bother to acknowledge our service. Instead someone had to step in and put us down. Very long wait time for our food & check. Even asked someone if they can bring out a sauce, it never came. Nonetheless, our order was good.. just wish it was more organized & timely. This location is bigger in size & my go-to lavender infused coffee never disappoints! That i appreciate.. but im hoping they make some improvement service wise.

Au4Z3j2CEJ3i955ZOG9vaQ.text: Trendy little coffee spot located in the West side of Las Vegas; also known as the land of Summerlin! Usually I get my Makers and Finders coffee from their location in DTLV but I was meeting up with a friend on the west side.  Both locations sever consistent food and give off equivalent vibes, in which it's a trendy spot to meet up with some friends and even work on some stuff through your laptop.  I am a fan of their coffee, as it isn't as bland as Starbucks and the croissant I ordered was pretty good. It's hard to mess up a croissant unless you're Coffee Bean, where I had a bad experience with a cold (!?) croissant!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AkjKP-62KcnAGxy-Zc1BXQ.text: The cafe con leche is legit. Service, though, just a tad slow. But it's because they're super busy due to making awesome stuff. Will be back the next time I'm in Vegas.

wMUEHPHroQJRJAtKXminEA.text: A premier coffee spot in Downtown Summerlin! Finally this local Arts District coffee shop now has a second location, as well as providing us with dinner menu!   Coffee connoisseurs will want to visit Makers & Finders.  Nope, no chain drip method at M&F.  Here one will see the array of methods in crafty your choice of coffee cocktail;) The staff are friendly, kind and patient.   M&F provides a menu for all, vegans & vegetarians rejoice!  Breakfast, lunch and even dinner come one and come all!  Proceed to the coffee bar on your right for that caffeine hankering.   Foodies, please wait to be seated:).  Artisan espressos, Cuban coffee, and THAT tumeric latte are all crafted with flavor and provide an outstanding aroma.  Quite tasty caffeine mixes and outstanding service that is synonymous with Makers & Finders- whether you are ordering out or staying at M&F.  One will immediately return and enjoy the warm atmosphere here.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A patio with heaters!
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NoBBP8hnSxb-dkW4GjAV0g.text: The food at this location is hands down amazing! I love the atmosphere, the food is always fresh, wonderful, fantastic, and flavorful. But, the three star review comes from the poor service this location provides. There needs to be some service standards training done wit this group. Make sure when you order your drinks you are ready to order everything due to the fact you most likely won't see your server for another fifteen to twenty minutes. This review does not stem from one visit, but multiple with the same result. They do have bottomless mimosas, but good luck getting more than two in an hour span of being there. Also, their mimosa portion size is teeny tiny, so try and order a couple if you can cause you'll be parched for quite some time. Getting a refill will also take a solid twenty minutes to make it to your table just a heads up. Once your food is dropped make sure you ask for everything you need including your check because you will also be waiting for close to half an hour to forty minutes for someone to check up on your table. Even had the same experience when we had management serving us, so dear owner, please help this location

9G5AMJ7Bqgtkcj6s2u3sbQ.text: Five stars five stars five stars! If I could give this thing 1 million gazillion I would. When you walk in it is the most crazy thing the exterior has this giant oak door and it's totally unassuming. You would breeze right past it if you didn't have it Geo pinned on your phone. This place is not a cheap cuppa coffee or breakfast foods, but it is well worth it. The coffee and food are excellent the staff is courteous and efficient. One of the huge wins of this place is the Decour they have a whole myriad of seating styles and environmental a statics that just pop and so many unique ways. They have an adult garden swing inside... A garden swing! They have multiple nooks and crannies for people to post up and enjoy their cup of Joe or an extraordinarily well crafted signature beverage. Be forewarned however, this place gets slammed in the wait times are not kind to the soles of your feet. Also seating is not standardized Due to all the little nooks and crannies so if you have a party of two or more you need to make sure you find a place, post up and then send your comrade to go get your food :-). I will definitely be going back there... With the help of my trusty Geo pin!

7t3QZh3xq5bZLnf0N8bzDA.text: The location downtown is wonderful but downtown Summerlin is amazing! The staff is great, especially  Christian!!!!! The decor is modern and the outdoor patio is a great place to people watch and enjoy the weather!!!!

WuZbDNcuoVB8CKKmVgaYLQ.text: So disappointed!!! Very bad costumer service. Came in with my family to try this place because I heard it was good so I figured let's give this a try. Walked in had two people waiting in front of us no biggie just waited and waited about 20 minutes later I got fed up and went up to the to go counter and asked is anyone going to seat us we all have been waiting for 20 minutes and no one even came up to us just ignored us. So then the gentleman said he would get someone right away but right away ended up being 15 minutes later the family in front of us walked out very upset and I felt horrible for them cause as soon as they left then someone came to seat us. Now I'm irritated and unhappy for the wait they then sat us next to this huge table with 10 loud costumers so rude! and the music they had was so loud I couldn't even enjoy my food.  The only thing I enjoyed was my coffee which by the way had been sitting on the counter for 20 minutes while we received our food before our coffee yikes!

7Clfm_nqsTvk3110tMIzMw.text: What a great experience! I stopped by with my teenaged girls for dinner not knowing it was opening day. The place looks beautiful the food was great ! We had the bandeja which is I believe a Colombian dish served with steak, rice and beans , avocado, fried egg and plantains it was delicious. We also ordered the Empanadas and the arepa with chicken which was absolutely delicious. The owners Josh and Omar are brothers and one of their managers Joye were so friendly making us feel so welcome . I will definitely be going back . Btw did I mention their coffee was great ! Try the Bon Bon  if you like your coffee sweet !

ee8k2mPxOllc09rIVN22fA.text: I'm so glad this place open here in summerlin!!! It's the best coffee shop in town! The food is great and the drinks are just perfect. Try the empanadas sampler it's worth it. Also the bon bon!

0sJ4AydXnz4dtQyfS0thDw.text: We have been going to the one Main Street for over three years, now they are in Downtown Summerlin and they opened today. We took our family there for lunch and the food was great! Coffees are always terrific and the management is on top of everything. So glad your up here now, welcome to Summerlin!!!!

0wnbMi1oCE-xWwjabEWHyA.text: This is a great place for coffee! Their cafe con leche is my personal favorite. Staff is extremely helpful and nice!

kSjaZq1RSqtuVlLcjiFoPQ.text: I hate this place so much it's the worst service at both locations and the worst management.....they need Bar Rescue at both locations badly

uFmK7fXL5DfbWAy8-frd-g.text: Christian, THE server was so awesome and nice. My coffee was delish! The setting is super chill and relaxing. I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6xGlNEXpfc8uzRwvjgE_DA.text: Best coffee in Summerlin!!! Empanadas were amazing and the customer service is nicer than any Starbucks or Coffee Bean in the valley. These guys know their coffee!!!!

hUIM3J8CnrnKzCABnxuxPA.text: Maybe my visit just wasn't the right time for me to visit. Came here on a Sunday just before 11am and decided to stop in as I waited for the shops to open up. It was a nice day out so I requested a table outside. There was one available but it needed to be cleaned off so I agreed to wait. As it was being cleaned off and the dishes were being taken to the back another couple comes in behind me. A gentleman (I'm assuming the manager) asked me if I'd been helped and I told him yes so he assisted the couple behind me. He takes them to a table in the back then they ask to sit outside. He then takes them to the table outside that I was waiting for to be cleaned off. The lady who was cleaning the table off then walks me to the door outside and then sees the couple being sat there and just says "ohh sorry can I sit you here??" I said fine and sat at the tall long table. I'm watching the food come out and the coffees being made and see a cinnamon roll that looked delicious. So I asked to order it I'm then informed they're all out...great yet another strike. I just ordered a coffee which was okay. Then I'm trying to enjoy my time and then someone gets sat right in front of me at this long table, there were plenty of other seats. So now I'm staring directly at this guy I have no idea who is...awkward. Probably won't be back

MzUoJg2xvXU0NdZjmjnmyA.text: Really cute place and in a great location at the center of downtown summerlin. To be honest my husband and I just had lattes. We were a little disappointed with the latte as it tasted watered down. I know they may not specialize in coffee, so I will probably give them another chance!

do2KfCOVG9s_FssmgstlwQ.text: My new favorite spot! Coffee/food is delicious. Location is perfect for us locals. I love the lavender latte and the rajas arepa. Portions are just perfect. I absolutely love the vibe.

osT0vGcMwDCmFayEzQx0fw.text: This was one of the worst dining experiences I've had and I didn't even get to eat the food. They told us there would be a 30 minute wait which we were willing to do. We went to the to go line to get a coffee and they told us they were not allowed to serve us a to go coffee because our name was on the waiting list to dine in. I explained that we only wanted a coffee and the lady was very snappy and said she couldn't. There was no room in the restaurant to wait so we casually waited next to the serving bar and another server came up and yelled at us because we were in the way.  We kindly explained we were trying to get out of the way for him and his staff. At this point, we decided to leave and asked the hostess if she could remove our name because we felt like some of the service was not kind. The hostess didn't even look up. She said, "Oh, really? Okay." I have never seen a more unprofessional group.

Dp7Au5HSUUmUirrYpOTd8w.text: The food is delicious ! Highly recommend the shrimp seviche , it's perfection ! And the lavender latte is to die for! Can't find it anywhere else. Not to mention the customer service is the best!

nVDSNNNu3w25KRZLYPVbyg.text: Nice coffee joint if you're looking for something high end! My favorite drink is the Lavender latte, though the prices can be changed a little. It's in the middle of Downtown Summerlin, so what are you gonna do though.

-NM63UJncHEp2OMYADSPew.text: Wow! Empanadas are delicious! The Mexican spice latte was perfect! Not too sweet. Service was great for opening weekend!  Will be back!

lWr-EoDT3gT3vc9qwZZXSg.text: I picked this place to meet up and catch up with an old college buddy. I've been to the one in downtown LV and liked their coffee then. This place was a good lively place to hang out and chat. I would sit on the patio when the weather gets warmer. I love coffee and only black. I was not disappointed with the quality. Will need to come back for their food next time to speak on that part. No complaints on this visit.

bSB9di-NDfaUyMaGb8ZvPg.text: I've been here twice since they opened in late December.   The Empanada Sampler is amazing! The spicy mushroom empanada makes me think being Vegan wouldn't be so bad, lol! The other empanadas were also really good but I think my favorite was the beef with chimichurri, sooooo good!  I'm not much of a coffee guy and whenever I do drink coffee it's with friends and I always get what I consider to be "fufu" drinks. I definitely don't take my coffee black! That being said, I had their lavender latte and it tasted really good! I think the lavender gives it something the big coffee shops don't seem to have.  The first time we went service was a little slow. But it was day one of opening and really busy so I can understand. The second visit was around New Years, the service was pleasant and quick.

sewDnsmot_IyT_UtT6kFLw.text: So we first fell in love with the downtown location of Makers.The food and coffee were always consistently good. So when the Downtown Summerlin M&F opened we were over the moon to have a location closer to us. The first couple of times we went we were very pleased with the food,coffee and service. These last 3 times we have come unfortunately have been majorly disappointing. We order the same 2 drinks every time and they have tasted different every.single.time. On top of the fact that the taste of the drinks are inconsistent (which is odd to me, shouldn't the baristas be taught a standard way to make each drink?) the waiter has either forgotten to add a shot of espresso in our chai tea latte, forgotten to make it a large (but charged us for a large on the bill) or just given us a wrong drink all together. And I could go on about a couple of other inconsistencies with the food as well but I'm quite honestly tired of typing. We have come at least 4 times in the last 2 weeks alone but this will no longer be our go to breakfast spot. My advice to the owners if you read this is to better train your staff and cooks. With all that being said,I do believe you have a great spot with quality food and a special concept! But your employees lack of training in preparation of said food/drinks or lack of caring in general maybe, will likely have other regulars finding another spot to dine as well. No one wants to roll the dice every time they step through your doors.

2xeLXhz1rISV5R71Gjxtyw.text: Best coffee in downtown Summerlin. I love the atmosphere and service. Everyone was very prompt, accurate, and welcoming. Food was also spectacular, can't go wrong with the Colombian social.

EHlB37CYuK0D2fUXDn4mJg.text: Sucks Yelp doesn't allow you to give negative stars because the service I was provided on Labor Day 2019 at 6:50pm was horrible. Never have I had a manager or shift leader tell me ah yeah yeah you will be fine, after complaining to her because we waited one hour for our food. Her response was yeah yeah you be fine. Wow just shocking I have been here many time on busy occasions and never took that long or had a bad experience but this did it I will not be disrespected specially paying between 60-80 dollars a visit for service like the way she gave me I rather go to McDonald's dollar menu and get that service and pay three forth of the money. To add seems like she had a groups of friends that where there she was too busy attending to her friends than any of the paying customers that where at the restaurant. I ask my self what kind of owner allows this kind of behavior ? But more and more I read review seems like the owner doesn't improve this issues. All I can say please be wise of where you spend your hard earned money and precious time now a days there's so much competition that you can choose anywhere but the quality and service is priceless just a hint that can be useful. My overall rating is -100 for this place!!!

nCort3QJkQxzCncJGgi4Dw.text: Came all this way to meet a friend up cause we wanted to check out a trendy new cafe. THANKS YELP! Lol so we came across this one and decided we would do a little shopping after. Inside: the inside decor is cute and so chic! Almost reminds me of a BOHO coffee shop I once went to in Portland. I was just a bit confused at first because in regular coffee shops, you go up to the counter and pay for your drink then that's it. But this is an actual sit down type of cafe.  Drinks: so the lavender latte came highly recommended by our wonderful server. Also, because we wanted to get a coffee art for the pictures (haha!) but the taste did not disappoint. And I usually drink coffee but man! For some reason, their coffee made me feel so awake. Which is a good thing if you're trying to stay up to study.  Food: food wise, & this is where the one down star came from..  I thought it was pretty mediocre. We got the nachos on happy hour.  Service was great! Ambiance is welcoming & coffee was delicious.

Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GaVfYZOHpymfzYx4KxKfPg.text: This place rocks!  The food is the best in Summerlin, as a latin person the food taste just like back home.  As a suggestion a must try are the mimosas. Loved the platanos, arepas and bandeja paisa.

NIejynVo22RPscvlmLuXHg.text: They say location is a key for a business to thrive. I'm quite pleased that M&F, a downtown LV gem decided to open a location in the west side of Las Vegas at Downtown Summerlin. The open patio and charming lobby makes this place an excellent place for photo opt for IG and Yelpers. The main draw is their delicious coffee drinks with the Lavender Latte being among the most talked about drink. I personally like their Vanilla Honey Latte. A perfect combination of a smooth coffee taste and sweetness. The honey compliments the vanilla flavor giving you a balanced latte that is relaxing and satisfying.  I haven't had much of their food items, however they make a delicious Empanada platter and Caesar salad from my previous experience at their original location a few years ago. I would come back to enjoy more items from their Latin influenced menu.  2018 Yelp Review #25

YNhD_FBfEzXak_S30IIA0Q.text: After going to different coffee/breakfast places, you can start to tell the difference. Unfortunately, this place is not on my top 5. I got a lavender latte, which wasn't bad, but I've had better. The berries waffle was ordinary. And the veggie Benny was good, but not that great.   The ambience is trendy and the customer service was good! We didn't have to wait long for our food like the other reviews stated (maybe coz it was 8am).   However, the food and the coffee is alright... nothing that exciting.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender latte with soy

g1anCDQ2yshqPbDqzLDGcA.text: From a 5 to a 3. My first experience a few months ago at M&F was amazing. Great food and coffees and really good service. I've been back weekly for a month and a half and everything has slowly gone downhill. The service has gone from great to bad...the food takes FOREVER and it just seems like they can't keep up. Really disappointed in the decline.

RHxgsjQN_Y60OLRWe3AMfQ.text: I love this place! They have the best chai tea lattes and everything I've had off the menu is good. Zack has been our server a few times and is always great! He is attentive, friendly, and knows the menu really well!

6AUSDlURlCCfuLbxCWRXJw.text: Two Words: Instagrammable Place  Cool place for those who like to IG and blog - beautiful, modern decor. I used to go to their downtown location and I was quite excited when I heard they were opening up a new one here in DTS.  I really love their coffee beverages. Really unique combination of flavors.   They really need to improve on their *quality* of food. I was feeling basic and ordered an avocado toast. Their bread wasn't even toasted and it was just 4.5 slivers of avocado and they used a third-rate salsa to top it off. Extremely disappointing.  I'll definitely come back for their beverages and for some more Instagram photos.

PQERmnVClRsXYe8P4ct8qQ.text: Great food and service. Food was served right away and it's 10/10. Everybody has been telling me to go to this place and I can see why now!

Agy6-QtOvbT4eYt8ypTHQA.text: My friend had been raving about this place and I just didn't get it... until one day for lunch we stepped foot into makers and finders and I didn't want to leave!   I ordered the empanada platter (carne and chicken), which also comes with black beans, rice and a small side salad. Omg. Whatever is in the sauces atop each of these empanadas is HEAVEN!!!!   I am also a huge coffee person. Like give me a drip line of that stuff and I'll be one happy lady! My lavender latte was amazing. My friend and I joked about how my design looked like a sad pumpkin while she had a super cute heart on hers. But, pumpkin or not... every last sip was full of flavor and worth the $6! I especially loved that there was real lavender sprinkled over the latte.  I was also lucky enough to be able to try some of my friends chilaquiles (I may have puppy eyed her to snag some)... and now I don't know what I will order next time I visit! Everything was just THAT good.  Bonus- my work is within walking distance... so if I want some yummy food every day, I can happily make my way to M&F!

Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uxa8gENC4-cvc4m4yS86jw.text: What a great unexpected surprise!! The restaurant itself is super cute. Great indoor space plus a nice patio. Our server was very nice but it was even better that every employee walking by checked on us. Though, the real star here is the menu! It's actually why we came in. When looking for a brunch spot, my boyfriend noticed all the gluten free options. I'm GF so we knew this was a must! We had the egg white omelet with smoked salmon, the arepa short rib benny, and the veggie benny. The gluten free corn cakes for the Benedicts are delicious!! The short rib was perfectly seasoned, veggies and their hollandaise was excellent, and the omelet was far better than typical boring egg whites. We also had lavender and hibiscus mimosas. They were great too!! We'll definitely be back for another benny day and to try the lattes!

qVx6bcBE5Q-0JFT25BS_Dg.text: I really liked that spot! Met up with a friend to catch up. The food is really good and perfect portions. I had the chimchurri steak sandwich and it was delicious! The steak was cooked perfectly, nice and juicy. I liked that they have Jarritos to drink! The staff is very tentative to the customers. I would visit again, I just wish they had a location on the south side.

1175xF4-9TqZPJzKGk3kIg.text: Pretty cool little place, I feel like it is a little overpriced but I understand that they have to pay rent too haha! I feel like a lot of their dishes I could make at home. So I am not extremely impressed with that. I am impressed with their decor and the vibe that place gives. If you are into ambiance and an instagrammy looking place then I recommend this!!

2M1Y4O9u6cEwwwgh8EY8fw.text: Came in on a Friday for lunch and was pleasantly surprised that it was their Violin Brunch hour! They had a violinist playing his take on today's hits and he was AMAZING!   I really love the modern decor and their outside seating but that was unavailable. I was seated at their bar top since I was a party of one and it was a little cramped when they sat people next to me.    I've had their coffee before and it is pretty good but overpriced $4.50-6 per drink item.   I really want to love this place but when it comes down to it- I could make this food at home and the portions are small for the price. I ordered the Avocado salad $9 and added chicken $3 which sounded like avocado and corn would be the highlight of the salad, but really, it was a ton of barely dressed greens and some corn hidden in there. If I hadn't added chicken, I would've been sorely disappointed. Even with the chicken, I left somewhat hungry and disappointed I made the effort to go out to lunch.

d6QrmoPR5NlU4xDApFYlAw.text: My family and i walked in at 4:42 the lady in the front turned away many customers away.. she told me "sorry we are closed" i said I'm sorry but you close at 5pm it says, i can't just enjoy a coffee with my family?".. then she said "yes but we are closed ". Then i said "why are you turning guest away it's not 5pm..i told her all i wanted was coffee not a full service..: she said we don't have customers past 5:20 in here....so i ordered at the bar and had a great coffee called Lavender latte witch was great. & btw lady at the cashier with red hair was a doll....But i felt pressured, so we left immediately after 5 min of the stay... just quote me if I'm wrong please ... business is open 9-5 on Sunday that means turn your customers away at 4:40???....  Coffee = 5 stars

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

I-zarZLBVir2GPg0huBZog.text: tl;dr: Good food, good coffee, and best enjoyed as a brunch / afternoon tea spot. The Lomo Saltado was awesome.  "I really just want a cup of coffee." - That's really how this adventure to Makers & Finders started to the heart of Downtown Summerlin. Their coffee are as many as their food choices and the atmosphere is very relaxed.   I ended up getting a Sea Salt Caramel Latte & the Lomo Saltado. The latte was your usual affair, but probably made much better since outside was pretty cold and I wanted something warm. The Lomo Saltado was great; it's a testament to food when your table-mates keep taking food off your plate.  Overall, solid place to visit and meet-up with some people you haven't seen in awhile and just want to sit around and chat with a nice cup of coffee and a bite to eat.

-nMm39ANdz2bgmO5-66MlQ.text: Teeter-tottering between 2-3 stars, but since it's only been open less than a month I decided to give them 3 stars. I'm hoping that my honest review will help give this new location the push they need to strive to be better.   ORDERED: 4/5 - Honey Vanilla Latte (coconut milk since I'm Vegan AF): Delicious beverage but unfortunately it came out barely warm, and a warm latte well... that's just no fun.   3/5 - Vegan Empanada Sampler: Yay for vegan bites, mehh for the taste of these little guys. Lacked flavor and again these weren't nice and toasty like I expected.   4/5 - Warm Coconut Vegan Soup: Flavorful, semi-thick creamy soup which would have received a 5/5 but I had to send it back because it was cold just like everything else.   1/5 - Vegetarian Burger (minus cheese): I highly advise everyone NOT to order this frozen, Morning Star burger. When I asked the waiter about it he even said, "Well honestly nobody has ever ordered that" and now I know why. I appreciate them trying to add a vegan/vegetarian burger option on the menu but this tasted exactly like the frozen, off-brand plant-based burger from the grocery store, which is not ok when you're spending good money for a restaurant quality dish.   PROS: + Cute location in downtown Summerlin + Even though our server wasn't great, the owners did act very professionally when trying to assist us which was much appreciated + Unique, tasty lattes (try the lavender latte w/ coconut milk)  CONS: - Packed for Sunday brunch. Expect to wait for a table - Server seemed to be having a bad day or was irritated with us maybe? Either way, it was clear and it didn't make us want to return.  - All of our food/drinks came out either luke warm or cold  I really wanted to love this place and I'm disappointed that our Sunday Funday didn't include a fantastic dining experience. One day I'd like to return and have a completely different experience. Come on, I'm rooting for ya M&F!

E-WapURYXqjbZr0CGAzIBw.text: Great experience all around! If you're looking to start your day off right, mid day pick me up, dinner before or after shopping and a movie... let me be the first to say that downtown Summerlin has found our Maker!   Educated staff, traditional empanadas (maybe the best in town!), food cuisine that everyone can indulge in! Please note, veggie and vegan options too!!   Lavender latte to go please!!   Happy to have a piece of Downtown Las Vegas in Downtown Summerlin. Vegas Strong!

6JxsvFSE25dzWTNRwU2z2A.text: Decided to try this place after a coworker recommended. I called ahead because it was Independence Day and wanted to make sure they were open. Score they were but only until 3p! My family and I arrive, unfortunately there was a sign that stated they were closed for a private event, it was noon. Insert scooby doo sad face!! The woman who picked up the call never mentioned closing for a private event when I called! Luckily I still decided to go inside and a gentleman who looked like the manager greeted me. I asked about the sign, he did confirm there was a "private event". I asked if he could make the exception since we live on the other side of town...literally 25 min away. He looked around and said sure but asked me to wait as there were some ppl ahead of us waiting to be seated...hmmm private event? People waiting to be seated? At that moment my husband whispered to me that there was no event, they just wanted to get out on time for the holiday. I quickly became super observant out of curiosity...and sure enough my husbands assumption was correct. That really set the tone of disappointment. Why lie to customers for your own personal agenda? Your hours are typically until 5p...if you wanted to close earlier then close earlier! No need to place a bogus sign out front to discourage patrons. Anyway, off of my soap box! Fast forward to ordering amd food. Despite having a small crowd (due to the sign) service was slow to get our orders. But once they took them the food came out pretry quickly. I ordered the breakfast empanadas. It was tasty but i yearned for more filling. For $3.50 each I would have hoped for just a bit more filling. My husband ordered the burger, super tasty. I also ordered the Lavender Latte meh nothing to write home about, it was good but I wished it had a bit more flavor...could juat be the coffee brand they use. The ambiance is cool, pricing is a bit up there for breakfast but it is Downtown Summerlin. Rents are high I get it.  I would say come once to try it out, you be the judge. As for me, I think I will try the downtown location versus coming back here. Again, the deceitful sign to discourage patrons from enterting the establishment on the holiday really turned me off. But after dragging my husband down we had to finish what we started. We came, we saw and conquered...wont return.

J-TCrPqHLIACn2fblqzpXA.text: I went to this restaurant with high hopes. It's located in downtown Summerlin across from the Earl of Sandwich.  My friend and I ordered albacore sandwiches and the  Iced Tea. The sandwiches were not remarkable but our big disappointment was the tea. The tea was served in a small jar with lots of ice. It was refreshing on a very hot day but unfortunately they would not refill this drink. We spoke to the server and the manager and they told us firmly that there were no refills. nLbr_referq7ekafND6PsA.text: I typically like to give places three different tries before writing a review that is less than amazing. Particularly if the circumstances include cruddy service. I love the food and the coffee. Their Salted Caramel latte is in fact delicious and it's always a great idea to add lavender syrup into that goodness. As far as the service- I don't understand why these guys are always grumpy and borderline rude. When my family came into town last week, we sat at a table in the back. I had never seen the tea served that way, so I had asked how to drink it. The server said "Are you kidding me, it's Japanese style. You seriously don't know how to drink it?". Sure, if I knew what that was, I would probably have gotten it. The whole interaction was rude and the second time I went in, it was the same deal. I'll probably go back just because I work in the mall and the coffee is good, but I don't really expect a pleasant interaction at this point.  UPDATE: I went back in and the service was amazing. Thank you M&F

T8wKamKHUfs9wxO16Ik9UA.text: I've been a fan of the first M&F locates in the arts district area of downtown Las Vegas! I love all of their craft coffee menu and the food is pretty damn delicious too! fV4Ui1eLfroelGDvWwhe-w.text: Have seen Makers and Finders at Downtown Summerlin and wanted to try it, so met friends for lunch today. It was a very unimpressive experience. Ordered the turkey club that advertises maple bacon strips and choice of crispy fries. I received a turkey sandwich with once piece of very undercooked bacon spilt between each half of the sandwich, minimal slices of turkey, and too much lettuce to make up for the lack of turkey and bacon. Asked for garlic aloi on the side, had to ask a second time and was provided a teaspoon of sauce that barely filled half of the small silver cup. "Crispy fries" were neither crispy or hot. They did provide new bacon after I showed them mine was undercooked. Server was nice, after taking our order she checked on us once then a second server checked on us after delivering the food.  No water refills or  condiments offered, and all the silverware was left in the middle of the table- in a pile we each had to dig through to find what we needed. May try again, to see if it was just an off day.

PjrCCGN-Mn240KdQBaMMPA.text: Love this place! The staff is friendly and attentive. The food, as always, delicious! You could never go wrong with the pourover, but the lavender latte is my favorite.  The ambiance is comfortable and welcoming!

Fk8NudJBaMW-koT7yDEgmA.text: Sadly I experienced the same lack of appreciation for business as others have noted.  Walked in and although there was a guy at the front he not only didn't he say hello or I will be right with you he failed to make any eye contact and walked away. 9u7k6DVQp64AXFdmxGzh6Q.text: I was super excited to try this place, mostly because of the raving reviews. I finally went in today and I was super disappointed.   My boyfriend and I decided to give it a go this morning. We got there and they said it would be about a 10 min wait - totally ok. We saw a few empty tables but didn't complain and just waited until we got seated. Two couples came in after us & got seated right away- totally irritating. After about 15 minutes of waiting and getting annoyed we got seated. It was pretty busy but not busy enough for them to take forever. Kitchen staff seemed pretty quick and on their feet, it almost looked as if the frontline employees (servers, hostess, etc.) didn't know what was going on.   Food finally came out and it was mediocre. The coffee was great. If I go back it'll only be for the coffee & I will take it to go

YDsSX9sjaNadoFCayMTq0w.text: I had a Lavendar Almond Latte  Highly, highly recommend. This artsy Latte was velvety and just the right amount of sweet. My Husband and I shared an Avocado Relleno, Empanada Sampler and Arepas (recommended by our Waiter). The food was absolutely delicious and very flavorful.

jbKcfewHUeR-ZBsRhPiuLg.text: So happy that they finally opened their second location in Downtown Summerlin! If you have been around Las Vegas, specifically Downtown Las Vegas, you would know they offer, hands down, the best coffee in town and their well complimenting food!   The new location's coffee and food are consistent with its original quality, but what's enhanced is the ambiance! It's open, spacious, and upscale; it's definitely a great hangout place. The new location had a soft opening late last month and picked it right up to keep the service on point because its staff are friendly and efficient. I highly recommend this place to everyone in the Summerlin area. You can't go wrong with their food, especially coffee!

d-GxtDfgaK4JMCxId8n1VA.text: Finally! Makers made it to Summerlin! I have been wanting to hit Makers up for a minute now, but for some reason I am never around DTLV. First off I just want to say that Makers knows what hospitality and kindness are especially when it comes to accommodating your circumstances. We had 5 and a child and they made up tables and chairs within a few minutes due to the influx of people on opening night flowing in and out. In the mean time they accommodated us with refreshments as well as a super comfy couch  Now let's get down to the ordering.   Wife got the Hibiscus tea, very good very fresh. I got the Honey Vanilla latte (OHMYGOSH) it was too bomb. I was waiting for a Starbucks feel to hit me, but Makers latte is much more flavorful and bolder, very rich and creamy. It was ridiculous. Def recommend their latte. Next time I'm trying the Salted Caramel.   Appetizers we got the Empanada platter, comes with 3 dips and several kinds of empanadas, and the Latin poutine fries, comes with gravy and a fried egg pretty bomb. I heard their Arepas are authentic and bomb, def getting them next time.  Entrees, my wife got the Bandeja paisa, comes with steak and a huge cut of Chicharon! Super good, and of course I got the Sofrito Burger house favorite, Angus patty with bacon, mozzarella cheese and a fried egg . They're in the perfect spot in DTS for great food, drinks and music. Go check Makers out def coming back regularly since there on the Westside now!!!

vNlqcSpECahR0vCECsZ5KA.text: We love this place. My husband, daughter and me usually go there on weekends for a branch. And this place is so good sometimes there is a live music and that guy sings awesome songs  my daughter loves crepes and lavender coffee with milk actually all the coffees they have are so so tasty and rich flavored.  The workers and the place itself are very friendly. We highly recommend this place!!

Ub0RJOyOG3k3iANi5J5lQg.text: Love this place.  The food is really great.  I've been to both locations.   It's a small place so be careful  when going during peak times.  Service has always been excellent.

Hb11xlxRRxSiJyRpO-7DKA.text: First time in, 2 days before Xmas. We got here around 1045 and there was a short wait for a table but we sat at the counter right away. They've only been open a week or two and everything is still pristine. Most of the employees are clearly seasoned in restauranting and handling the holiday busyness with ease and bringing along the one or two newer employees with less experience. The cold brew coffee is fantastic and the matcha latte is above average. Food is on its way but we are next to where it comes up and everything on the menu comes out looking incredible. Really looking forward to when the weather is a little warmer and we can brunch outside. Been waiting all fall for them to open and they delivered on quality of product and service   Update: It's best to think of this as a restaurant that serves coffee and not as a coffee shop. We popped in on a Saturday afternoon and waited so long for our carryout drinks that we might as well have waited for a table. Doesn't take away from the quality of the product but we probably won't 'pop in' anymore.

j3B6puiRAhImm0KxrFQmdQ.text: First Time Here, We Ordered The Mexican & Lavender Latte's. Avocado Toast & Croissant (not the best, avocado was black they tried to hide it with a bunch of salsa, croissant was warm but hard to chew)  Everything Else Was Amazing, From The Decor To The Service. Definitely Be Back For The Drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xpZvpkUIBNygxfYRIg2onQ.text: Good food and great service. Unfortunately a very cold day meant no outside dining so the inside was super noisy. No big deal.  My only real complaint is the chairs are so uncomfortable we left quickly and grabbed coffee and dessert elsewhere.  ( maybe that's the point?)

26LSgNQKGXgFxYX0igu0RQ.text: "Make good coffee and people will find it," is how I feel about Makers and Finders! Ironically tho, my favorite drink there is the green tea latte!   In addition to coffee, they offer a breakfast menu as well as a light bite to eat such as avocado toast.  It's a casual coffee house with a touch of modern, artsy vibe. They have charging outlets for your smart phones or iPad at the bar, or table seating to relax and enjoy your food, drink and company!  Their location in Downtown Summerlin is my favorite spot to unwind, relax and kill time while my daughter's iPhone receives some attention at the Apple store across the street, lol!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I&#39;ve tried so many times to make this at home, but it&#39;s never as good!

WgxQ_XnkYrL-9kqDUVAphQ.text: The coffee satisfied our caffeine and flavor craving and the service was exceptional. Jacob was our server and knew exactly when to be present and personal and was attentive to our guest requests. We will be back for the coffee and definitely for the service. Thank you for the great beverages and service M&F!

dlOLN_SXdH9CP1dn-KcTtg.text: Horrible customer service! We came on a Sunday for brunch and were given a wait time of about an hour to come back.  We came back after an hour and had to wait another 45 min. They placed us at a very small table that was definitely too small for our group. We asked for a larger table and the manager refused. He wasn't even polite about it. He just stated that he's not willing to accommodate us and it is what it is. Very uncomfortable meal and terrible service. Not coming back.

z7uaJRlO5AIbRv5vo8qwDA.text: THE BEST BRUNCH I have had in a very long time. I came here with my best friend to celebrate my birthday. I poked around on the reviews and I have no clue when these bad reviews went   Anyway. Justin was our server! He was super friendly and funny. We chatted as he waited on us and he made some suggestions on the menu ( which I like since I want to eat it all! )  We got the mimosas. All of them were delicious though I enjoyed the lavender one. Great food. We got the breakfast empanadas, Brussels sprout and bacon skillet , arepa Benedict and the churro waffle without blueberries and added chocolate chips with caramel. The churro was per Justin's suggestion. The manager was friendly and the atmosphere was great.  The two of us tend to get terrible service everywhere we go.   I try to not complain as I have a customer service job BUT I try to review great restaurants. This was one.  We can't wait to go back

YDTFO5OhNE7_RfuKV2AwQg.text: When my daughter, a local, said we needed to have breakfast here, I thought it was holiday hyperbole. I was so off in my assessment. This place has one of the best breakfasts in the LV area, and absolutely THE BEST coffee drinks I have had in America. Between the three of us we had a lovely mix of offerings and everything was perfection. Our server, Bianca, was welcoming and delightfully attentive. The kitchen is open concept so patrons can see every moment of culinary creation. A True joy and well worth repeat visits.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cortadito.  The brilliant offspring of love and caffeine.

eQzy3tdbleDL8tBMqt56Hg.text: So I was invited here by the nurses league.  We are a big party of 17. As a former server, I understand that big parties can be a lot to deal with, especially when people don't arrive at the same time. But our server, Andrea Jackson, was amazing. She handled all our parties needs with promptness and grace. She was so friendly and was very attentive to our needs. Andrea made sure all of our mimosas, coffees and waters were filled, our tables were cleared and everything was satisfactory. I know that's a normal server's job, but the way she handled our party I felt she went above and beyond expectations. Whenever I come here, I would definitely request Andrea. She made my visit worth it. Thanks Andrea!

O28HfXNdi_ZdA_LJlpKDjQ.text: I wanted to try something different for breakfast because I wasn't in any mood for eggs and bacon so we came to Makers and Finders for brunch.  I started with the warm coconut soup ($5.00). I'm used to Thai coconut soup so this tasted different than what I was expecting. It's more on the sweeter side. I ordered the Coconut Turmeric Latte ($5.50) because Turmeric  is so hot right now...just joking. I like Turmeric and I like coconut so I was curious about this concoction . It worked! It was good. The latte has Coconut syrup, cinnamon, espresso and Turmeric. Every time I took a sip it felt like a warm hug! I decided on the  Empanada plate I had the mushroom and the chicken tinga. The chicken tinga was my favorite it's the first time I've tried it and I didn't regret it. It came with rice and beans. I ate the rice because at the time I didn't eat beans at all. I'm starting to try more and more beans so I will definitely be back to give them a try this time!

S3uOjWySf0jnd0RioTpfbA.text: The lavender latte is an absolute must. It is the perfect combination of a light floral lavender flavor coupled with just the right amount of sweetness and bitter espresso. I'm glad I live a bit away from here or I'd probably be at this location for the latte way too often.   I had the latte along with two delicious empanadas. They were so good I ate them and forgot to take a photo. One was the chicken tinga and it came paired with a crumbly cheese and a drizzle of their house pink sauce. The other was filled with three types of cheese. They were served with black beans and rice that were both good but forgettable. Forego them and save yourself the $2.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6lu--IsQ-jjL_DKjB5noFg.text: The service was excellent. The Chicken Tinga was very good and full of flavor.  The house coffee was good and the only coffee with refills.  I had 1 Chicken Tinga empanada.. OMG I could have eaten 20 LOL Boyfriend had the Avocado Relleno and really enjoyed it. Prices were very reasonable and the portions were just right.  This place is a keeper

PnxrvSoNWqJM4d2d-KiL4A.text: Love the cortadito (espresso shot with condensed milk) it was perfect not bitter not sweet.   Ordered the chilaquiles for a vegetarian dish, they were perfect.  Great service even with a full place and people waiting to be seated, If you want some good coffee and great food, and something local and can rip yourself away from Starbucks lol you should try it.    Almost forgot the reason you should go try this place! Espresso flan!!! Amazing and no further explanation needed, order it and you will understand.

RoQ2yXh1-yzV2y-sKsKTLQ.text: Always have been a huge fan of Makers and Finders since the first time I went to their DTLV location.   The food is extremely consistent and I am a HUGE fan of their empanadas and aioli fries! I always get a chicken tinga empanada and another one! It's always so good and delicious. This time - I did get a full combo plate and to be honest, I should've saved the $3 because I could live without the beans and rice. Always have to get the fries and my boyfriend was in love with their overnight chia pudding! Even the table next to us was complimenting how beautiful the presentation was! We also did get coffees and I'm a big fan of the lavender iced latte with almond milk! So good.   They still are working out the kinks but they have so many options that I can't wait to try here for my weekend brunches. Btw - great place to brunch! Definitely will be back to enjoy some cocktails!  I'm so glad they moved to DT Summerlin! Definitely will be back in the future! And do yourself a favor - at least get one empanada! They are so good and worth it!

fCyCyJL8QplcDrQinNAfwg.text: I understand that this place is busy being that it's in Summerlin center, but the wait time was ridiculous and the hostess was one of the most miserable people I've ever met. She was soooo rude. Our waiter has been completely inattentive and our food took almost an hour to come out with ZERO concern by our waiter. In fact he seemed annoyed that I even asked.   The food here is GREAT but the experience ruins it.

wt2VIcU1DA1eVNVZ5I7J1Q.text: I was happy to see a legit coffee shop enter the downtown Summerlin area- M&F took over and transformed this space, adding their great coffees and an extensive all-day menu of Latin inspired favorites from breakfast through dinner, including vegan options and alcohol.   Some of my favorite drinks and dishes here include the lavender latte with house-made syrup and the turmeric-coconut latte for something different. The breakfast empanadas are tasty and the arepa benedict is a good go-to for a first visit, but I'll need to return for the avocado relleno and sofrito burger. I hear good things about the coconut tres leches waffle if you're into sweeter options.   But this really is more of a cafe than a coffee shop, set up more for dine-in service rather than grab and go. I've tried to pop in here to grab a drink on my way to work and there really isn't a good place to queue up and service has been consistently slow and somewhat disorganized.   TIP: Happy Hour is 4-6PM with discounted food and drinks!

IX4JiAzbOm9DBurgQiYN3w.text: The food tasted really good. I got the steak with a substitute of crispy fries instead of what was included. The steak was very juicy and the fries were very crispy. They cut up my steak into bite size pieces, which I though was a very nice touch. My husband ordered a latte and chilaquiles with eggs. Everything tasted great.   The 4 star rating was because the prices are set too high for what you get. I can understand that their rent is higher in Downtown Summerlin, but the cost versus the product is too high for me to want to come back on my own.

t_I0vG0PNBOUheN7MJNmqA.text: Had a late brunch here with a friend who was very excited to bring me because she enjoyed the food from her last visit here. Ambience was nice, food was good, however service was HORRIBLE which is mainly the reason for my rating.   I had the avocado toast (per Yelp it's one of their popular dishes) and the matcha green tea latte.  The toast was ok, the cherry tomatoes on top were delish. My friend had the chillaquilles and dirty chai which she truly enjoyed. I had a bite and it was very flavorful and savory. I will have to get that next time, IF I decide to come back.   Now the service. Our server ruined everything for us. We were seated by our hostess, barely looked through the menu and our server comes to take our order. Doesn't introduce herself (I think her name is Skyler from looking at our check), asks if we're ready to order which we weren't. She was about to walk away until my friend had asked her if she could order a drink. At this point she appeared irritable. She came back a few minutes later, took our order and that was the last we seen of her til we were done with our food. Didn't ask us how we were doing throughout our meal, or bother asking if we wanted dessert, just returned back with our check when we were done with our meal and that was it. We had to stop 2 other people to ask for condiments. She clearly wasn't busy with other customers which could explain her being MIA since she was sweeping the floor. The other employees we encountered were pleasant and helpful.   This has had to be the worst service I have ever experienced. We walked out feeling like our business wasn't appreciated. Maybe I'll try the other location in DTLV.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado toast and match green tea latte

Zh2H64fFPvipCdBcsrkE3w.text: Super cute cafe in downtown summerlin . Outside seating is heavenly on a pleasant day . Everyone that works here is so friendly and go out of there way to accommodate you . The coffee is the best I have had in Vegas , you can get coffee to go at the walk up counter if you don't have time to dine in . Personal favorites are the Lavender latte , the iced tea and the chilaquiles

u3OpnJbCbX2TG80ToS19vQ.text: Went here last night and it was an "okay" experience for me. Ordered mocha latte and Maduros which is basically a banana plantain. The plantain tasted good to my surprise.  Staff were nice but the service was too slow for a Monday night. Saw some costumers who were kinda irritated about the slow service considering it wasn't super packed. But the couple right in front of me seemed to enjoy their orders since I've heard them complimenting their meals, so I guess it was pretty good. Will give this place a a second try but will check their Main St branch next time. Will recommend to anyone!

The vibe inside will keep you around if you don't take advantage of the spacious outdoor patio. Definitely won't hesitate to drive across town again to have brunch.

_fPNP7o5TEfgH7Rb2Qkr-g.text: Absolutely fun, and amazing place. The food is great, personal m, waiters and waitresses especially Joanna. Joanna the best waitress. She super nice, attentive, great personality she made everything perfect. Perfect place to come and have great food. This place totally recommended.

RccrW0JG98ikhSmeHpv7Fw.text: Good food...absolutely abysmal service from the hostess to the food delivery.  Downtown location is good, skip Summerlin.  Checked in with hostess, she asked us to wait about 15 minutes and sit on the couch.  25 minutes later, with multiple empty tables we inquired about table...somehow she thought we were waiting for takeout?  Been twice, won't go back.

s8rtWTDti5wRUv9we0R5Xg.text: I'm in love with the lavender coffee here! Yesterday I got it iced for the first time and oh my gosh it was amazing! So much better than starbucks or any regular coffee shop. I'll definitely be back for more!  also the service there was great, I took my coffee to go and I was in and out in less than 3-5 mins and everyone was so friendly. Glad this spot it closer to me now!

Tbr5IM7TAMObd12mkWSNhg.text: I'm literally still here and couldn't wait to leave a review. Our waitress was Carly and she provided the most amazing service. She is personable and outgoing, she made excellent recommendations and honestly makes me want to come back all the time!!!! We got Latin Poutine and we added Chicharron because she spoke highly of the flavor!! Best decision. I'm very satisfied with my visit and I hope everyone that eats here experiences her magic.   Thank you Carly !!

wLlDeUSEo_ji4MYxpPIHfA.text: Coffee was great but the staff was very unorganized. They need to develop a better system to distinguish guests who want to dine in and those who want to grab coffee to go. We got drinks to go but kept getting asked to move by the staff at the bar but there was also no where else to move to because it was kind of busy. For some reason it took forever to get our order rang it too. Hopefully these are just growing pains and the organization will improve.

v_j3ZblFgMMcoQ0MzVh40A.text: Absolute terrible service today when I had lunch here. Couldn't believe how little the server paid attention to our table, almost seemed to be deliberate. Won't be going back here anytime soon.

MOCBUbnCBLBMpyNprWp2iA.text: I have no idea what everyone is complaining about. Amazing food and prompt service. I had an omelette for $10 which is by no means exorbitant. Flavor was yummy - I'd definitely go back! Cute ambiance. I hung out all day working on my computer because it was so pleasant.

zQChbkMCLX28005XKRqDDQ.text: Best single source coffee in town. The place has a nice atmosphere and their food is amazing. Try the arepa benny.

nUqhn90b0CVtU2P-XCmuFw.text: Loved the one downtown so when i heard they opened one close by my house in downtown summerlin i was so happy love the atmosphere, coffee, and food it can get pretty busy definitely worth the wait staff was amazing by the way especially manager christian who always make sure people are attended too its 5 stars in my book glad its close by now

RkWPnZ3WH9jRD7HNQBJtAA.text: Makers & Finders is hands down my favorite coffee shop in Las Vegas! The ambiance here is great. It's a favorite of mine to hang out, grab coffee and just read a book. There's indoor seating and a cute little outdoor area too. My favorite drink is the lavender latte. Their food menu is awesome too, I have tried a lot of the items on the menu and none disappoint! Staff is really friendly and make it a fun place to be. There's even live music on occasion at M&F! I personally prefer the Downtown location to the Summerlin location, I like exploring the surrounding places Downtown, but both are very great! Would definitely recommend if you're looking for a more unique coffee shop.

Vv35ItzoD5OXV8pTja8ISQ.text: Deserves Negative Stars: This was the worst experience I have had at a restaurant in my entire life. We had party 15 people. After 12 of the meals had come out the waitress asks if there was "anything else that the table needed"...completely oblivious to the fact that the three people in front of her did not have meals. She then stated that she was going to bring them out. After 40 min she returns to the table with our meals. Mind you, everyone else's plate had been cleared from the table already. After a member of our party asks if our meals could be comped, she was told the receipts have already been "printed" &  a discount was never offered. We waited another 15  min for the receipts that had already been "printed". When we finally got our checks the gratuity had already been added to a meal that we waited over 40 min for. Between the three of us we spent over $100 dollars and we were compensated with drink vouchers. Brandon said this was all he could do for us. I never intend to use the offer because that would mean I would have to go back. Don't come here with parties or if you're in a rush.

Ymy9HfLHdQ60UaDgmHXIpQ.text: Not sure I was at the same place as everyone else, but maybe going on a Wednesday late afternoon things are different? Met a friend for lattes, Those and two dinners to go totaled $37.00. Service was excellent, as was the coffee, food and ambiance. Regarding the prices, they were less than I had anticipated. Go and enjoy!

8GaKLvMq6V0srMIpLoK_hQ.text: Absolutely delicious food!! They have vegan and vegetarian options...yah!! Great presentation ...  Wonderful friendly staff and very knowledgeable...  Cannot wait to go back and try their fabulous coffe and tea menu!

rxs94NT4V1KzB5Fxtmx96Q.text: Loved it. You gotta order the coconut coffee or the cortadita. Also order the chillequiles. I swear I wish I had. It was nothing like chillequiles should be but it was really yummerz!!

I just moved to Las Vegas and went really for a cup of coffee but when I walked in it had the coolest vibe to it so I decided to sit at the bar and look through a menu. I ended up getting the Chicken Omelet and ordered my sister the tuna kale eggs Benedict. It was all delicious as well as the coffee. They also put a side of plantain chips on your plate that are crisp and very good too

cvml33lqCziE0IC6baKuGA.text: So excited for amazing people forgive me our server Wallie...ups don't remember and hes amazing 100% ....my friend Michelle and I want 2 catch up....food 100....team 100 manager 100 ...drinks so great that I drop mine ....wow 100 all accross.....Kyrenia....many more visits to come yay

WUEauztZWHVpZtvBTxG9uw.text: One of my favorite coffee shops in Las Vegas! Get the iced salted caramel latte, it's amazing! So happy you opened another one in Summerlin!

H6FxBx5y0IYPCLiRsueFZQ.text: Personally love the lavender infused latte and arepa benny. Everyone is always super friendly too!

4kLq15Aj1yMxR-8g0NtEzQ.text: Very delicious food quality. However the service is pretty terrible. I witnessed employees standing around on their phone while my food sat in the window for 10 minutes. No one offered to refill my coffee either. Also, some lady that was dressing the food was texting over the plates she was dressing. It seemed to take an unnecessary omg time to get anything done. Even the check didn't come till 15 minutes after our food was complete. The coffee was delicious the meat was perfect and their flavors were great!!

x4dyMAgB4Y88wx9MWUX61A.text: Had an excellent experience at Makers and Finders! Great selection of healthy foods, include vegetarian friendly ones! I opted for an iced matcha latte with almond milk, which was perfectly sweetened. For lunch I had the veggie bagel with honey cream cheese which I thought to be odd at first but was surprisingly satisfying. Christian, the manager, and the rest of the staff were very friendly and welcoming to my large group of girlfriends. Will be back!

5jMaW_kqKqs94OqrSF11Kw.text: Obviously the coffee was amazzzzinnn my mistake was I was hungry and the food is just an ehhhh. I got the avocado toast which I don't think should ever be that hard to make and it wasn't good at all also got their version of steak and eggs the rice was the best part. All in all the coffee is excellent which is what they're known for but if you're hungry there's a skinny fats next door which has amazing turnip tacos so stop there first.

xbYcurF4DEgxqnfZVdppdg.text: Just ok. Coffee is well-made with very good flavors, but both mine and wife's came out cold. When we asked if it could be heated up, they couldn't for sanitary reasons, that's ok, but offer to remake it?  Smoked salmon Benedict was tasty, but again, served at room temperature.  Mushroom empanada was mushy, not crispy at all, and covered in a cold red sauce.  Whole dish was cold. Do not order.    Side of empanadas were tasty, not too sweet, and, FINALLY, hot. (Not burning though)  Wife had Bandeja Paisa. Steak was ok, fried egg was slightly undercooked, beans and rice tasteless, pork was not good.  Whole plate was cold.    The servers' aprons are cool looking. Nice attention to detail.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maduros are worth it. But not much else was good. Maybe get them to go.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushy empanada. Skip it!!

xb53civUCrQuKPVcoYSw6g.text: Fairly small and kind of confusing if you've never been in and just want to place a to go order.   When I first walked in, I wasn't really sure of where to go or who to talk to. There is a register in the front behind the counter. I don't even know if there is a host/hostess or if you seat yourself. I lucked out and just kinda drifted in the right direction towards the register and a spaced out employee.  Unfortunately, I can't really judge the coffee or food- I'm a tea drinker. It's a little pricey for the size and what you get. I was super unimpressed with my unsweetened iced black tea. Meh. There's a juice bar down the way that is much more satisfying (IMO).

7OSgbeMpcvU8NyWeBNXmuQ.text: First the good stuff:friendly staff,very accommodating  and coffee is awesome. Location is perfect and atmosphere is great.  If you are planning to eat I would skip, food is absolutely tasteless, everything has zero flavor....not sure how to describe it better. No matter what you order it's just not good, I've given it 5-6 times and mentioned it to nice people who work there. I am not a picky eater at all, but it would be nice to be able to have a bite while there. We only go for coffee now but not often, hopefully they will fix the menu.

9TyA2pusIyeYzsgr3ujDcg.text: I've dined here about 6 times. In the past I had a stellar experience. Today the stars were behind the clouds.  11:30am on a Saturday. My partner and I wanted a nice weekend brunch.  She: Chilaquiles and an iced coffee drink. Moi: Chicken Tinga omelette, hold the onions. [note: onions are not listed on the menu as an ingredient, but my Spidey senses told me to specify just in case].  She: menu said sour cream on top... none present. These were NOT Chilaquiles, they were nachos... a bed of tortillas with items on top and popped in the salamander to melt the cheese.  Moi: ONIONS in the omelette! Nuff said. No coffee refills. I had to go up to the counter to get my java filled.  I asked for Paul the manager to come by. He pulled up a chair and pretended to care (sarcasm emoticon). He said he saw sour cream being placed on her dish (effectively calling her a liar). He said their Tinga's are made with onions (as if any child knows this to be True). He nodded and acted and asked what we wanted. I said "just to be heard".  All that being said, the food was yummy and the coffee very well done.  Enjoy if you go...

Jx71lJ79k1E_zpkMWJ_-cg.text: I love the Makers & Finders downtown so I was pretty stoked that there was a location slightly closer to home. But I gotta say I was a bit disappointed, mainly because of the service. The quality of food is the same as the original location. But the service here needs some work.   My boo and I came here on a Saturday around 3. It was pretty busy but there were several open tables. We were told the wait would be about 5 minutes while they prepared the tables. After a while, the hostess proceeded to take us near the back where there was a large communal table to seat us there. Why did she just assume we were okay with sitting there rather than asking us first? I don't want to sit with other people when there's plenty of other tables. We told her we wanted a table in which she responded by saying it would be a few more moments.   I observed her slowly putting utensils at the tables and stopping to greet some other guests. I'm pretty cranky when I'm hungry so I was a bit annoyed that she couldn't just seat us. When she finally did seat us, she didn't even have utensils there. It was just the fact that she lacked a sense of urgency when it was apparent that it was busy that was irritating. I don't think the world revolves around me but I also have had better service elsewhere (i.e. M&F downtown location).   Anyways, after being seated, our server was nice but was no where to be seen at the end of our meal when we wanted to pay to leave. We just wanted to get out of there but had multiple different people help us with the payment process. It was unnecessarily prolonged due to inattentiveness from the staff in general. I am definitely going to stick to the other location.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. La paisa

b3MfvFq98Jtm9QfUHr2oqw.text: This is the 2nd time I've been here and have to say it might be my new favorite place for brunch/breakfast. The food is excellent and the service is also great. The staff really takes care of you and never makes you feel rushed. The Latin Hash is a must try in my opinion, the short rib is so good. I've never had anything I didn't like and they have a great selection of coffees.

Tos_FC4UkyvS49R6RvqVeQ.text: I came here for the first time today. I had the tomato soup cup and my girlfriend had the avocado salad with tuna. The food had a beautiful presentation, and was fresh. I enjoyed it for the most part. I will have to come back and try some of the coffee and other food items. The decor was beautiful, and I loved sitting on the patio. Service was only ok. They left us hanging for a while for our box and check. Seemed like they were busier then usual. Otherwise a decent experience.
