Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_BhHycDAMgPlBmeh0Xrfsw.text: My family and I love this place. But service is hit or miss. Depending on the waiter you get your experience can be good or bad.

WAbs3MJWcx1TIndhrJ6KsA.text: This is my second time here, and the coffee never fails me. I came on a Sunday, and it was packed! The restaurant got quite loud, but the atmosphere was still nice. I ordered the lunch power bowl, and it was pretty good. The chicken was juicy and cooked thoroughly. I was quite surprised by the large portion; I even had enough left over to take home for another meal. For my drink, I ordered an iced lavender infused latte, and it was really good! You can definitely taste the lavender, but it doesn't taste like soap. It was very pleasant, and I recommend it to people who are looking for a unique twist to a latte!  The reason I took off a star is that my latte and food took almost 30-40 minutes to come out. Also, I think it was the manager who we asked for our check (because he was doing it for other customers as well), but he was quickly distracted after talking to another table for almost 10 minutes and forgot about our check. However, the servers and hostess were very nice and quick.

UqKCzmXMckZwPSAD0Lbrvw.text: I finally got around to trying this restaurant/cafe! I've been meaning to check out the downtown location but I'm so glad that another location opened up at Downtown Summerlin.  I've heard many things about the lavender latte and figured I had to try it out. I got it iced and I honestly thought it was okay. I now realize that I'm not a big fan of lavender flavored anything. I'm glad I tried it though. I'm really wanting to try the matcha latte next. I also tried the Latin hash without onions and it was delicious! I put some hot sauce on it because hot sauce makes everything better. I'm really wanting to try their dinner menu so that'll be the next thing I try.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

s36le8REum7b94M_gWmLTg.text: Fantastic food and coffee and matcha! Best place in Summerlin for sure! Particularly enjoyed the waffle and the yogurt and granola!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BAnzcOXW1W4YkmTZZTXDjg.text: Love love LOVE that they have a second location in Summerlin.  This space is beautiful. It's a Yelper and Instagrammers dream location! So many incredible photo ops.  Swooped in on a busy Sunday morning to grab some java to go. Ordered the Honey Vanilla Latte with almond milk from the lovely gentleman behind the coffee bar. Pro-tip, you can pass by the host stand and walk right up to the counter behind it. There you can place your order and wait on the comfy couch for them to call your name.   Although the man behind the coffee beans was quick, I did think that it would be more efficient if they ran that coffee bar with three people. One taking orders, one prepping the cups, one person on the bar. I noticed the host was missing quite often too. This place is popping and it may run more efficiently up front if they had a host taking names and another host to escort guests to their table. That way, the host stand is never left unattended. Just my two cents.  My coffee was delicious. Nice and hot. Creamy and sweet. A nice little Sunday treat.

TEMmWoHE6ANoupeuM5QcPw.text: Love the downtown location and the ownership, so I have made an effort to visit #2 whenever in Summerlin. I went about a month ago and it was not a good experience. But, today was a complete 180. Server greeted us quickly, drinks rapidly arrived and were delicious, and the food came out within 15 minutes. We enjoyed the chicken Tonga chilaquiles and a queso empanada. I noticed a lot more families visiting this location and I know they will continue to grow as a family friendly spot.   Job well done!!

jcBjYZwQJnuw13LAg_jdUA.text: The food and coffee were phenomenal. The service is very mediocre. We were ignored the entire time we were dining.

_C3fUAToQPXxRmUNetXrqA.text: This new location in Downtown Summerlin is very spacious with a nice patio area.  We came by for a drink and I immediately spotted the Honey Vanilla Latte on the menu.  As I've had their famed Lavender Latte at the Main Street location, I wanted to try something new.  I ordered a small with almond milk and it was ready in no time.  I loved the flavor as it wasn't too sweet. I'm looking forward to another visit soon when I can sit down, enjoy the patio, and some food.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Latte art
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What&#39;s left of my Honey Vanilla Latte
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey Vanilla Lattes

UpGID7OmuzMnBDZb4Z04Bw.text: The coffee was good. A little pricey at $5+ a drink. Decor, atmosphere and service were great.  My one complaint is that the tables are pretty small, so if you are going with your laptop, the table will be very crowded with the laptop + drinks + food. I feel like that's a big downside for a coffee shop.

qhfSbs5wDJ2CnRIkPBelGw.text: Absolutely love everything I've ever had at this restaurant. From the food to all the coffees. We aren't even gonna talk about the desserts. The space is cool and fun. It is a tight seating area so maybe not great for large groups but there is a lovely outdoor seating area. I go often just to order a coffee to go. They have unique options like a coconut turmeric or lavender latte. Amazing flavors. I drink them way too fast and always want more :)

erAmMMmOQmpwE_2YKbXEPA.text: Great food I would highly recommend the yuka frites and the Lomo Saltado plate. Justin has excellent guest service skills and was able to answer all of our questions.

oUJWBZbpQFpAexl-SOpkCg.text: You like taking pictures of your food? SO DO I!!! This place makes yummy things, but also, you can make them look super #aesthetic. With lots of succulents, a million varieties of coffee, and good food, it's a pretty complete package. On the outing pictured below, I had the mango arepa and a mexi mocha. They asked me if I wanted milk substitutes before I even had to ask, which spared me my normal embarrassment of needing decaf with almond milk. I don't even like mangos, but it was friggin good. I've been trying to mimic the balsamic glaze, but I just can't. Oh well. My sister got the empanadas, which are also tasty. She also has special ordered most of their items to get no eggs because she's allergic, and they are great about recommending substitutions. Everyone who works there is super stylish, the decor is rustic, there are vegan options, and it's right next to lush. Pretty perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l1kj2PafNXuC-Pw-cocVkg.text: Makers & finders is a beautiful coffee & tea restaurant with Latin inspired food. I first discovered this place in downtown Las Vegas in main st, so I was super excited to see this new location in downtown summerlin. This location is definitely more fast paced and busy than the other location. There's a lot of seating available and a patio area to enjoy outdoor seating. I only stopped in for my sea salt caramel latte, and the quality was the same! Ambience is great for coffee dates or to eat a good meal for lunch or dinner, not a quiet ambience to study like some other coffee shops. They have a big selection of drinks, coffee, tea, even alcohol

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5J6i3o3_2q3HCzapeAKzIg.text: I love this place. Every time I go, I've taken a friend who hasn't tried it - M&F alwaya impresses! My favorite coffee order is the Cuban Cortado - basically a flat white with condensed milk. Perf.  They have delicious veggie options. I love my veggie Benny and the empanadas always bring a smile to my face.  The customer service is top notch. They go above and beyond. Highly recommend for the service, food, and ambiance. Chill and fun!

igC7kJLv2TI3x6GLUQXj5g.text: We came here to meet friends from out of state for brunch. It was a Thursday about 945am. It took about 20 minutes until someone came to take our drink order (mind you we sat directly next to the POS system and adjacent to the kitchen). Once we finally ordered our food it came out in a reasonable amount of time. The food was delicious. Kiddo had pancakes , we had Chicken Tinga, Smoked Salmon Toast, and eggs, bacon, and potatoes. Besides the food though, I wouldn't recommend this restaurant. It was exceptionally loud. The service was not great. It took another 15 minutes until we finally handed the server our check when she walked by without acknowledging us. All in all, it seems this review is similar to most others. Average service for An above average price.

Fmc-2BvM4zJfaAVNXphJUw.text: If you are looking for decent service and a good meal, this place is not for you!  Ordered a vanilla latte, no vanilla so they bring out a small cup of syrup to put in the coffee after it was cold because it took 20 mins to get the syrup.  My husband's turkey sandwich sat under the warmer while my son and I were eating our meal for 15 mins, as 4 employees were standing around on their phones.  My husband's ice tea and water was never refilled.  The service is horrible and the food was so, so.  Don't bother.  The one closer to downtown is great, so we thought we would try the one closer to our house, what a waste of money!

JhktB2T8Cu3_-CIE0nY4sA.text: If you don't mind a cute coffee shop that nickles-and-dimes you on everything, then this is THE spot. Overpriced coffee: I ordered an americano with almond milk they charged me for the almond milk. If I wanted a tiny bit of lavender syrup in it, they were going to charge me for that as well.  I ate there as well: I got the driest nachos, just hard melted cheese and jalapenos on it. I asked if the nachos come with salsa (as nachos normally do) & the manager said yes I can bring you some... and lo and behold he charged me for that as well. This place is overpriced; if they want to charge those prices they need to step up the quality of their food & the items on the menu.

Jp1Lvjk_qtov2GKeKOq84Q.text: I've been looking for a place with a good honey Lavender latte and I found it here at makers & finders. My cousin who is strictly Starbucks had a taste of my coffee and was instantly hooked. She got the same latte and we were both so happy for coming to Summerlin and stumbling upon this place.  The cashier was so kind and inviting. When my cousin ordered it was a different cashier and she repeated the order and asked if it was whole milk, which I appreciated bc it's so important to ensure accuracy.  The restaurant is bigger than I thought. They have indoor seating as well as outdoor which is great to enjoy the cool weather.  There's such a gorgeous couch in the waiting/take out side. The whole place is just so inviting.  Thankfully I live nearby so I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the honey lavender latte.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So spacious and well lit with open windows. Perfect for catching up or working on your laptop.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Such a beautiful couch

tMJOK4mUyi3DnzMjYKQVXw.text: Amazing breakfast. I am a late comer to this place. So many of my friends speak so highly of this place. Gave it a shot today and man it was good. Service was great and the food was awesome. For sure we will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Latte.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussels sprout breakfast skillet.  Bacon and Brussels Breakfast

FZkTHeOl0RA6JSGYS7f3mQ.text: What is there not to love about this place!? I mean it's in Downtown Summerlin, you can park right out front if you go before the mall opens and they have the best baristas EVER!   The food here is unique but in a good way.  The coffee is awesome and if you  are like me, you will LOVE their latte's.  I think I like plain latte's but here I always get the salted caramel latte.  Simply amazing!  Did I mention how great the baristas are here? Friendly would be an understatement.  I love this place!

cMg6ROIWhbqJT-WawIs-dg.text: Large portions served for lunch. Service was speedy  The tables were small so this would not be the best place for a full out dine in trip..  The match and lattes were delicious  The food was perfect in taste for a good quick snack.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jdO8WuLeCuVkzH39zcEueQ.text: This was a pretty good little breakfast spot in downtown Summerlin....it has nice indoor and outdoor seating however it was very busy and the tables are relatively close quarters so kinda loud with people and music considered. Now for the food I found there menu interesting with how they categorized things. Example: the between bread section and on bread section. Both had a salmon type entree. Now I love my lox and cream cheese bagel so decided to try the smoked salmon toast (on bread category) you would think it would come open face bagel style. When it came it was 2 pieces of bread and everything was piled on only one of the pieces of toast....so basically they expected you to make it into a sandwich? Lol. Very disappointed due to the fact I usually like to save half of my salmon cream cheese bagel (in this case toast) for later. Ultimately I had to divide what came on the one slice of toast between both slices and it just wasn't as good. My friend got the croissant breakfast sandwich and that was pretty good. I also got the chocolate and creme croissant and it was NOT good.....maybe my taste buds were off but I nor my friend were a fan...probably didn't help that it was a little over done.....nonetheless like I said cute place and the food looked and sounded amazing maybe my picks just weren't good. I did go for the vanilla honey latte which was absolutely delicious....I want to try the lavender next time! All in all I would give it another shot in the future and definitely worth a first timers try.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate creme croissant twist
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Croissant breakfast sandwhich
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. On toast smoke salmon....I took off capers and added tomatoes

wLntz2Qy97EwTQT-csoZZw.text: I can't really comment on the food or very many of the drinks, but the ambiance is quite nice. Cute little coffee shop for you and your friends to come to and have a nice little lunch on the patio or inside. I usually come to get a coffee and I'm never displeased with their coffee. I drink it black so I'm pretty simple. Their menu is really big so they kind of lose me there but they have plenty of options and a nice vegan option if that's for you. They also offer cocktails and beers but I'm not really sure how that fits in but in all it's a cute little place to come with a date or a group of friends. It's noisy enough to where you wouldn't hear the other people's conversations. If you were on a date and were concerned about others hearing the awkward first date conversations I think it might be noisy enough to mask that. Cool little place!

BeMGIF9Kp7rWoZnehUwNYQ.text: Food great. Service is terrible and I'm easy to please. Inattentive is the best way to put it. Food came before our drinks.... they are S L O W.   It wasn't even that busy.

hEVL1Ohwy9HLnVjdPCJhUA.text: Great food and atmosphere. We ordered the ceviche, truffle fries, and empanada sampler. Everything was very flavorful and great quality. Will definitely be back. Also friendly and helpful staff.

s49Cm3SB65xlBJ9AKgLTgg.text: Very cute aesthetic Excellent location Great customer service A little pricey but places like this are expected to be I grabbed a large lavender latte with almond milk, which was $8, I would have been a little happier to spend 6/7 I love taking Home to go menus to look over for when I can go again but they didn't have any not a huge deal I'm sure I can find online  Would love to come for breakfast with my family one day

u0z3AjAVVeBnJ9kMG2Ls-w.text: Had brunch here with our friends today for the first time, and I absolutely loved my food! I got the vegan burger and it was so delicious, one of the best Vegan burgers I've ever had! I'm already wanting to go back!

-IQw1ZHkznkFbK86knZGWg.text: I love this place! Try the nitro cold brew, my absolutely favorite drink here. I also loved the empanada sampler. They have different kinds like mushroom and spinach's, cheese, meat, shrimp, and I believe chicken. All of them were amazing besides the cheese, didn't really care much for it. Last time I was there they were using Mexico beans and they have really good flavor. I've tried the siphon coffee as well, pretty pricy but well worth it for a hot cup of coffee. Went for breakfast and ordered the chia pudding and it was really good! Not overly sweet like some places have made it, nice texture, and was really filling. Nice outdoor seating for when it gets warmer. A really fun and relaxed place. Definitely try this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mMhXMny2_i0OP0QuCoyJrA.text: Let's start with esthetic...beyond cute place, let's just start there. Here are a few things about the esthetics though that might make it flow a bit better. First off check-in area, really small. Right when you walk in the door the podium for check-in is right there. No space to wait. Tons of tables in the inside make it feel a bit crowded.  I tried the coconut turmeric latte with coconut milk. Came out lukewarm so it had to be warmed up. Once it did it was so delicious. The smell of coconut and the spice of the turmeric is a good combination.  Went for the butter and berry toast and this is a must try with coffee! Toasted just right, creamy butter and compote just melt in your mouth. Will definitely be back for this.   They also have a cute patio area that is dog friendly that I loved as well. Enjoyed sitting outside with my lovely fur baby, coffee and toast.

o-s-TP4Rq_vU3UEAaoMmpg.text: Love this lively little coffee shop. They have outdoor seating which I look forward to when the weather shifts a little for the better. The food was really good with plenty of choices. I opted for the avocado toast which was delicious and a little different than what I'm used to in California. This was more of a baguette and quite hard moving a soft toast. I added salmon which was surprisingly inexpensive.  my friend also ordered us some kind of macha almond milk latte. I love exploring coffee drinks so this was a treat.   Really love the vibe here. Casual, laid back and a great catchup spot with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a15KaVSi1jEGumBoM9jUYw.text: Terrible service on Sunday morning- the hostess was extremely inattentive and unfriendly, waited 20 min for a table, ordered, waited over an hour for our food without a our waiter coming to check on us. I eventually went over to ask him what's going on and he forgot to put in our order. That shouldn't happen if servers check on their tables frequently. Having worked in the restaurant industry for many years, that's basic knowledge. Finally got our breakfast almost an hour and a half after being seated. It wasn't even that busy and the food was mediocre. I'll never go back. There are plenty of better restaurants around Downtown Summerlin.

ZuUAn7JwX7Z4IsV9hrmvuw.text: A great brunch spot for food and coffee in Downtown Summerlin. My husband and I found this to be the perfect post hike meal.   A busy location we were lucky to only wait a few minutes for a table on a Saturday morning. The inside of the restaurant is on the small side, but they have a nice outdoor patio for additional seating.   We started with their unique coffees. My Honey Vanilla Latte was delicious and not too sweet. The Coconut Tumeric Latte was also very good. Both were beautifully served like pieces of coffee art.  The House Empanadas had a delicious and flaky pastry. The filling inside and sauce on top were delicious too. My Chicken Tinga Benny was amazing. The chicken was nicely flavored, the eggs were perfectly poached, and the lime avocado cream really set off the other flavors. The Latin Hash + Maple Bacon was also a great meal. Everything we had was full of flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Tinga Benny
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Latin Hash
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Empanadas

mZWPglnT7vcP9uVqdKmBDQ.text: I feel in love with this place! My boyfriend and I went on a Saturday morning and the moment we walked in we felt welcomed. The hostess was kind and attentive. She gave us an option to sit inside or outside.We sat outside because it was such a beautiful day. My boyfriend had the Latin hash which was beyond amazing. He added and extra egg and was happy he did because there was a lot of short rib in the skillet. I had the basic bacon,eggs,and potatoes. Everything tasted so fresh especially the potatoes. My boyfriend also got the salted caramel latte iced and that was great as well. We can't wait to go back and try lunch and dinner items.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KAB7eV9dg15-fBKmOWyxSw.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE the folks at Makers & Finders, the downtown location (their first location) is our usual hangout spot when we need to step away from the office and refresh our eyes but their second location at downtown Summerlin is equally as great, we love their new layout, seeing the new staff and just seeing their business grow!!  Everything on their menu from Empanadas, Latin Hash, Coconut Chia and of course coffee is simply amazing which complements the always amazing service they provide as well.  Thanks guys, we'll keep coming back for those Latin Hash ;P

v4aHscSnLxeTMWIQSnKIxQ.text: We went twice this past weekend,  the food and coffee are good however this morning we sat down at 8:45 am, by 9 we still did not have our coffee or any server at our table.  Be aware that the service can sometimes be slow.

0MmXYJJmRNFpoVa2QPh16Q.text: The coffee and food is really good here. The portions aren't enormous but they hit the spot. The only issue here is that the service is excruciatingly slow. Going here to sit down and eat always takes about 30-45 minutes longer than you expect.

so3RcW-nDW76lj6HuGxDog.text: This place is usually extremely good food & always good but this time when we came we have waited 45 minutes to get our food. People around us got their food first when we ordered prior to them it was ridiculous our waiter came to check on us maybe 3 times. The food we ordered was extremely simple like for example Avocado Toast, the wait that we experienced was absolutely ridiculous and unacceptable. Then to top it off when we got our food it the French fries were damn near cold as if they had sat there forever. Chicken was extremely dry this experience makes me want to never come back.

vFbpqbf_GV2b8O3xi4sIyA.text: I just ordered a house coffee at this "coffee" shop. Worst coffee I ever tasted. It tastes acid like old coffee, water down and not hot at all. This place has nice decor but coffee sucks! For the price, I'm not expecting they made coffee like that. Won't go there again.

2kzMRaT-lR_TR5pslsECyw.text: I hate to write this review, but after giving this place multiple chances, I've decided after my 4th visit this is just not my place. The coffee is always on point and the menu is interesting and extensive, but the service is subpar at best. Not only does the food take much longer to prepare than most places, but there seems to be a poor system in place for the food to actually make it to the table. During my most recent visit, I stared at 3/4 prepared plates for my table sit on the bar for close to 10 minutes before it made its way over. By the time it got there, the food was lukewarm. The last meal finally made its way another 10 minutes after that only to find that the eggs were under cooked and inedible. I'll be spending my time and money on one of the other great, local breakfast spots popping up all over town.

OsdGf2wqrEfTR873zTOoIQ.text: I came here for breakfast on Tuesday 8/11 around 9:45.  It was not busy. I was very disappointed with my service. Unfortunately, I ordered the wrong coffee drink. The waiter saw how unhappy I was with the drink but did not offer to replace it. Those kind of experiences leave a lasting impression with patrons. I do not see myself ever going back there. The one I went to in old town Vegas is 10 times better in service and food quality.

5b6e5pK1VAaUFG3LeUHnpg.text: Very displeased with this establishment. The other day, my brother and I went to Makers & Finders for a lunch break. As soon as we get there, no one directs us, greets us, or anything. As we order our food, they say it'll be done it 10 minutes. Not too long right? All we got were a croissant and a bagel TO-GO. As we're waiting, 30 minutes easily passes by. By then, my brother goes up to the register and there was a young lady with red hair just staring at him. As he was standing there for a good five minutes- NO ONE asked him if he needed anything. He had to keep saying excuse before anyone would notice, which is ironic because there were multiple workers just staring and not doing anything. They tell us our food will be right out! As they're saying that, I can see our food just laying there and another 5 minutes pass by. By then, my brother and I are ready to leave the place without our food. Out of nowhere, a host asks us if everything is okay and if we got our food. I kindly said no but thank you, and shortly after someone right behind arrived with our food.   After that whole experience we didn't even get to eat our food because waited for 40 minutes! That took up our whole lunch. Sadly enough, our bagel and croissant were cold. It made me so upset. Later that day I called, asked for a manager and told him my experience. I was really kind over the phone but he just kept shutting me down. I stated how I work in a place where customer service is valued and I just wanted you to be aware of your work environment. You know what he said? He said "What do you want me to do? I know my staff try to do their best everyday and I can assure you they are a good team" this made me so upset because he didn't even acknowledge our experience as a whole but rather just defended his "team". There's other better coffee shops in Vegas. You can most definitely miss this one, you'd probably regret just going here- like I did.

K0Am0d9QY6RkQrcimyFbLQ.text: Arguably the worst cup of coffee I've ever had. And it wasn't just once, I've been here several times and it's consistently bad. For those of you who appreciate a good cup of coffee, this is not the place.

bKGC6EcjXGCyPewfnByE4Q.text: Wow - why the low stars!?! Summerlin Folk are so dang picky haha.   My favorite coffee shop in Vegas just opened down the street from my house and I am over the moon with excitement!! Been here 2 days in a row now.   Must trys: - Mexican spice latte - Cafe con leche (so simple and delicious) - Sofrito Burger - Arepa Benny  Great job Downtown Summerlin - I've been waiting for a rad coffee shop and you guys knocked it out of the park with your selection!  =)

vodNZY5IFipPQomh9JNxog.text: Have not had any luck at this new spot. Service was painfully slow with the serving staff looking overwhelmed.  Our food, (soup & grilled cheese sandwich), came out cold and had to be sent back.  25 minutes later, the replacement was still not hot, but was at least warm. The latte was tasty, but not at the temperature requested.  It was exceptionally cold inside with two ceiling fans oscillating which just made it worse. This was pointed out to our server, however nothing was done about it even though he said he would advise the manager.   Hopefully all this can be attributed to new opening jitters, we'll see.

goJ3IKAJcEBTTZ1vYCvh1g.text: Love the music and vibe  the Latin vibe going on. They have a little of centro America  makes me feel like home!

acHj-EWI9-uQrjQf-kevOw.text: As much as I want to give them 5 stars, they have one glaring issue.  My wife and I absolutely love their coffee bar, but it seems they have some real consistency issues.  We get the same couple drinks each time (hot honey vanilla latte and hot vanilla chai latte).  Sometimes they are off the charts good.  Other times it tastes like the barista has never made them before.  And not a subtle difference but a whole different recipe.  Makers and Finders is a cool spot.  Love that they opened in DTS.  But they really, really, really need to do some training on making consistent coffees.

H_xx1lnUwMP1ClnCfuKDmg.text: I've heard many good things about the downtown location so after a little shopping trip I decided to come inside for a quick bite and some coffee.  Service: 2 out of 5 It wasn't busy at all when I came in, with only one table of customers outside and a table of customers inside, so tell me why it took three workers fifteen minutes to seat me, a single person, at the bar? The redhead at the cash register asked if I was gonna order to go or for dining in, and I said dining in for one. After waiting for about ten minutes, a party of three had come in, and they were seated almost immediately by a male host, but it took another few minutes for a female host with short brown hair to finally notice me. I wish I had gotten her name, aside from the coffee, she was the only delightful thing about my experience.   Food: 2.5 out of 5 I ordered the "ripened mango arepa" which came with rice, fried plantain chips, and balsamic reduction. The mango was so unripe, I thought it was pineapple at first. Pale yellow in color, crunchy, somehow both sour and bland at the same time, it was not pleasant at all. The balsamic didn't add anything to the already sour mangoes, and the mozzarella cheese faded to the background. The arepa itself was tough and dense. Would not recommend. The plantains were the only redeeming thing on the plate, and they weren't even the main event.  Coffee: 3.5 out of 5 I had the iced lavender latte with almond milk instead of regular. They make their syrups in house which is nice. I liked the little bits of lavender at the top, and it wasn't overly sweet. However, the coffee wasn't mind blowing, and at $6, I left feeling like I could get this drink elsewhere for the same price, if not cheaper, and definitely with much better service.  I rounded up to a 3 because the one server was nice, and the coffee is decent if you're in the area and just want to stop in for a to-go order, but with ignorant wait staff and underwhelming food, I'd rather go somewhere else for my aesthetic brunch fantasies. I still tipped 20% because I also work in the service industry so I understand how it is. I had high hopes for the Latin-inspired menu, but left feeling uninspired. Hopefully the downtown location has better service.

The owner is a really nice and will help you decide on a drink and offer suggestions. They have several different blends and the smoothest cold brew I've tasted and I'm a coffee snob. If you're downtown and or in Summerlin and feel like trying something other than Starbucks I'd drop in. There are board games you can play and merch to purchase.

AetXKv61Cukd_-D2pTGbSA.text: I was at Downtown Summerlin and it was freezing outside, so I wanted to get something warm to drink. I've seen this place all over social media, so it's somewhere I've been meaning to try. I walked in and I thought it would be a casual coffee shop, but it was more of a sit down Latin American food restaurant that also served coffee. The staff in the restaurant had great energy. I really wish I would've been hungry because the menu looked so good. There were lots of vegetarian options. I will definitely be coming back to try the food menu. We ordered a cafe con leche and hot chocolate. The hot chocolate was served with homemade whipped cream and cinnamon on top. The cafe con leche was delicious too. I'm surprised the reviews for this place aren't 5 stars because I had a 5 star experience today. Can't wait to come back!

HotpBPZlIokHTkAbdMrY4w.text: If you're planning to go here for your first time, read this carefully.  Yesterday was my 4th time here and definitely my last and it's all due to the service. We went as a group of 4 for Sunday brunch, and it sure wasn't their busiest time of the day because of how many open tables there were. Coffee comes out great (as always) but the food took more than 30 minutes to make it to the table (again, as always).  I ordered eggs and bacon a la carte with a side of their short ribs - as basic as it gets. I take one bite into my food and it's cold. Not luke-warm, COLD. I let the waiter know and he didn't seem so thrilled that I said something - maybe he was just embarrassed? Idk.  Food comes back out of the microwave, we eat, we leave. About 6 hours later I find myself laid up with food poisoning and you really, really don't want to know how I could guarantee you that it was the short-ribs.   It's obvious that the food was ready way before the waiter brought it out to me, hence the reason why it was cold. This is what made me sick. I'm not an expert but I'm pretty sure rule number 1 of food safety is to serve it at the proper temperature. But this seems to be the common theme of my trips to Makers at both locations. Their menu boasts variety and exclusivity, their coffee and tea selection is out of this world (nobody else is bringing a French press to your table), but they really can't get it together when it comes to service. It doesn't matter if I only order a sandwich - I'm always waiting way too long.  Sorry Makers, I've given you one too many chances and now my body is paying the consequences for your crap service.

XUoVq4KJHwKUjkdjyWPprQ.text: If we could give a zero we would. We didn't even get to eat here because the hostess, a younger white blonde girl on Sunday 2-24 at 11:40am was suppose to putting people name down on a list for a table. We were waiting for her to put our names down and when she finally came back to the stand after 10minutes, instead of asking who was next in line she decided to put two other parties that just walked in before us and didn't bother to ask at all if we were helped. We were politely waiting for awhile. When we confronted her about the fact that she put parties ahead of us she decided to say "oh they approached me first"....so I guess that's how lines work in this place. If they can't staff properly or train the host why run a business in the service industry. It's obviously a popular brunch spot but super understaffed and unprofessional. Very disappointed in the service and rudeness. If you want to eat here on a weekend better come early and hope they see you to put your name down because there is no real system there!!!

Mi1TxGVs4abHLug8SL4oJw.text: Wow, the reviews are a little harsh for this gem of a place! Before this location opened nearby me, I tried the downtown location. The quality of the food is just as good as the original place! From chilaquiles to arepas,I love the Latin flair!! The items I have ordered so far have been the arepa Benedict, lavender latte, coconut turmeric latte, and the coconut chia pudding. Can't go wrong with that! My only complaint would be that when my friend and I first entered the place, it took a long time for someone to check in with us. be6sUBWAGeF4N6PadZtVsw.text: Ate here for the first time today during lunchtime. They were pretty busy so we ended up waiting 20 minutes for a table. The restaurant is nicely decorated with seating inside and outside. We ate outside, which was great since the weather was nice. We ordered Brussel sprouts, which tasted amazing. My daughter, whom doesn't eat Brussel sprouts, even loved them. They were a nice portion size. I loved the small cast iron skillet it's served in. We also had the crispy fries, they come with kale and an aioli sauce. I would have never put those ingredients together with fries but man it was so delicious. We will eat here again. My daughter had a specialty coffee and she said it was great.

piQRvQFImudl3IgbRP_m3w.text: My first visit on a cold & windy Sunday brunch day coupled with bottomless mimosas...  Makers service:  We knew we were walking in during prime time at 12:30 PM on a Sunday so we were ok with the 15 minute wait.    Our avocado toast came out immediately and there was about a 20 minute wait for our main entrees, all good.Our server was friendly and was extremely busy with the brunch crowd.  He was good with keeping the waters filled and our bottomless mimosas, bottomless.  What's even better is that two more servers would bring mimosas when our glasses were empty even though they weren't assigned to our table.  Great stuff.  FYI.  The bottomless mimosas is for two hours which works for me.  Makers Cuisine:  You get 1 poached egg and plenty of smashed avocado and cherry tomatoes on your four pieces of toast.  The ingredients were fresh which made for a tasty starter.  I had the Latin hash 2.0 skillet which was very tasty.  The short rib was flavorful which really made the dish.  Fyi, this dish is served in a smaller skillet pan which I actually preferred.  I tried the bff's Lomo Saltado and it was delicious.  Served with a fried egg and fries, I'm absolutely ordering this on the next visit.  Makers ambiance:  A long but narrow dining area makes up the main dining room.  There's also a bar for single diners which faces the kitchen.  There's also outdoor dining for when the weather is nice.  Decor color is predominantly white which makes for a pleasant dining experience overall.  It's going to be noisy when it's busy because they pack a lot of tables in there but nothing uncomfortable.  Overall this is a great place to grab some breakfast and brunch if you're in the Downtown Summerlin  area.  They also have a to go counter if you're on the move which I appreciate.  Lots of dishes to choose from with fresh ingredients will bring me back. Enjoy..!

opJWgckP8BXSvfk7ksNNYg.text: Don't know if Holiday was a factor, but this place was slow on everything.  We checked in and told the host first available table.  There were 4 on the list ahead of us and were told 1/2 hour wait.  We were back after 1/2 hr and waited inside for another 10 minutes. There were several tables available inside and outside.  But more people are coming in and asked to wait. We finally sat down and placed our orders right away (chilaquiles and waffle).  Waited another 1/2 hour for our food to come out and no watery coffee refills (thank goodness) and no sign of our server. Our food was good but it would've been good if it was hot. I thought of ordering a special coffee to go but was afraid I may have to wait another 1/2 hour for it.

From walking in the door, immediately being greeted to being sat down and receiving the BEST service in the industry from JUSTIN.  ordered Chilaquiles and ceviche, left nothing on our plate!!!!  Had the Cuban Cortado espresso and ordered it cold as well.  Great both ways!!!!  Definitely coming back!   Beautiful restaurant and cool atmosphere.

vcYM-78MNKj1xCk1p5P0Xw.text: M&F is such a great place to enjoy the afternoon sun in the shade with a wine, beer or cocktail and some study time, which is how we chose to pass some of the afternoon today.  We were greeted warmly by a friendly server who sat us immediately wherever we found suitable and met us very shortly afterwards with some water.  I can't comment on food or coffee as we chose to have a few alcoholic drinks, but the menu was varied and comprehensive, the server answered questions I had about flavours and offered me some tasters before committing so that I could pick something I would truly enjoy.  We ended up choosing the Kronenburg beer and the Makers and Mimosas cocktail. Both were delicious, however, for the price of the cocktail ($16) I wasn't expecting to have each ingredient arrive individually and be the one to make the cocktail myself. I realise that M&F seem to be attempting to do something a little different, more creative, fun and interesting with this, but after a couple of these cocktails and not much yet to soak it up, I would've been happier to receive this ready to drink rather than feel like I'm creating a science experiment with various glasses of juices and syrups.  Regardless, great service, atmosphere and delicious product. We'll be back again soon to try the coffees and snacks next time!

I've gotten the Chilaquiles twice and it was so delicious I forgot to take a picture! They give you the option of adding short rib or chicken tinga. caYCk3JWHB-aofl57gRS2g.text: Been wanting to go here to try their matcha latte and finally got the chance today! Makers and Finders is located in Downtown Summerlin next to Francesca's and Lush. They offer outdoor seating for those that are interested and apparently it's pet friendly. Service was friendly and I was checked up on frequently but not to a point where it got annoying. Onto the food!  I decided to try:  Breakfast empanadas: I loved loved loved the pastry they used for the empanadas. It's super light, flakey, with a slightly sweet flavor to it. I ate these so fast that I didn't even look what was inside (I was starving) it but I do know for sure it has eggs and potatoes!  Latin Hash 2.0: this dish would've been better if it wasn't so oily! The bottom of the skillet was really oily to a point where I couldn't finish it. I did, however, enjoyed the pulled beef.   Matcha latte: while this was good, it wasn't a favorite. I like my matcha latte to have more of an earthy flavor and this does not. It was also a bit sweeter than I liked. Next time if I do decide to get it, I'll ask for less sweetness. The presentation was pretty though. It was Instagram worthy :D   My main reason for the 4 stars was the empanadas and the service! I have my eye on the empanadas platter for next time!

FO8KngP19eDFj8X5CaHWEw.text: Take my hand let me guide you on a wonderful journey to delicious desserts and unbelievable coffee!  After some retail therapy in beautiful Summerlin one gets low on fuel, but lucky for us we found some delicious fuel! This is the second location of this local Vegas business. This being an extension of the downtown location, expect nothing but superb service, delicious food, and spectacular drinks.   On this visit we were renewing our spirits with exquisite delicious desserts. Is their really a reason to eat dessert first? No so let's explore the tantalizing treats makers offers that we savored.  -Espresso Flan, ordinary flan that has a shot of espresso baked inside of it, then has been covered in a lush espresso glaze. On the top is sea salted whip cream with strawberries all overthe plate. It's a heavenly masterpiece!  -Affogato which is an espresso shot over some kind of gelato. Makers affogato is a double espresso shot "drowned" in a scoop of vanilla gelato. The espresso brewed here at Makers is so smooth. As the espresso is poured over the gelato your mouth water for that enticing liquid. -Elvis Press dedicated to a great contributor of rock n roll. Elvis called Sin City his home away from home, and even he would be all shook up with this delightful dish. Nutella, peanut butter, plantains, and bacon share the same space on a croissant . Surrounding the croissant is a wonderful array of seasonal fruit, on this visit the fruit was blueberries and strawberries. All the fruit was fresh and made to order. This mixture was so yummy! Highly recommended both by the staff and customers alike.  The desserts here at Makers are pairings that one could enjoy as dessert or as a breakfast dish. Most of the desserts offer so much fruit that it's hard to classify them as dessert. The thought that has gone into preparing the exquisite menu and delicious creations is incredible.  Now that dessert is out of the way it's time for breakfast. My choice was a sizzling hot skillet that Makers calls Vegan Hash. While the Vegan Hash is a delightful vegan dish, I would recommend this to anyone. It is full of incredible flavor. The skillet includes chive cooked potatoes, with mushroom, asparagus, peppers, and onion. This mouthwatering mix can have avocado added which, of course is optional butadds even more dynamic taste. To pair with this fantastic skillet a salted caramel latte. The Caramel Latte was outstanding. The amount of caramel used was an equal balance to the Espresso. As you sip the latte the hints of rich caramel were in every amazing drink. Choosing to have almond milk in the latte only enhances its flavor more. The froth on top of the latte has a delicious caramel drizzle too!  Another noteworthy honorary mention here at Makers is the customer service. The team of associates from the moment that we arrived till the time we exited was so warm and wonderful. Makers and Finders employees some of the finest and most skillful individuals. They are truly genuine souls that have the ability to spread such joy to all those that decide to walk through their doors. It is an incredible accomplishment to be able to sit and relax for hours among beautiful family and friends and feel so special while enjoying such fine cuisine and top notch beverages!

M7QnhfixMUvF8enpfgT5Vw.text: Finally got to visit this cute spot during my trip at Downtown Summerlin!  I thought the whole theme to the shop was super cute! It's a soft white inside their cafe and their menu has a variety of items to try! Their greeter was also very friendly and nice. They even have an outside patio, perfect for a day with beautiful weather!   I only wanted to try their coffee for this visit and was extremely impressed by the drinks I got! I got their Coconut Turmeric Latte, hot. I was surprised that their smallest size and the size bigger than that both contained one shot. Maybe I'm used to my coffee spot offering more shots than most! Regardless, I thought the taste of the latte was divine! It was the right amount of a sweet and earthy taste.  My fiance got their Lavender infused Latte, iced. The first few sips were filled with lavender and was a subtle sweet! After a while, the flavor was blended with the coffee and then the lavender was really subtle for me. It was still an amazing drink. We are definitely coming back to actually have a meal here!

GDFGxBfyzRHmFMgA2APkOA.text: Wanted to love this place. But will not be back. With so much competition at the price point, did not deliver.   1- flavors are good. I got the arepas Benny, and it was flavorful. But deductions on: -eggs were not poached, no runny yolk, medium and just not what was described -the spinach was tasty but there was so much liquid on the plate from the spinach it soaked the arepa and made the arepa taste like spinach   2- service: waited 15 minutes to get him to come by for my check, and then finally got someone else to help me. QlC9MDVlSXtYchn5vzsnOg.text: I love the location on main st, but this one not so much. I went with his friend and wife and two babies. Could see it was a bit filled so didn't mind the wait. We were sat outside in a cramped corner outside in the heat. They had a swamp cooler outside where we had to ask for it to be turned on. In 104 degree weather. Our hostess did not hold the door for us not even the mother pushing the stroller. All the staff that Day was very monotone and rude. We waited and hour or more for our food to arrive, in which it was cold and dry and you could tell it was sitting in the window for quite some time. Our server never came back except once to fill water. We had to asks for our checks and then proceed to the counter inside for them to be taken care of.  At the beginning of the meal I Had placed an order for a lox bagel and asked for it to be put in halfway through the meal. When we went to pay it was on the check and the people looked like they had no idea what we were talking about. We asked how long it could be in which we were told it was being prepared right now. After waiting 10 minutes asked again andbperson behind the counter was astonishing rude. We were told 15-20 min. My friend made a comment that why so long for just a bagel with cram cheese and lox. The employee snapped back at us "Well they have orders before yours and it's a process to making it! You know it's not just a freaken bagel." As for all of us dining who work in restaurants, know how it is when you're in the weeds, but nonetheless would not take so long to put a "on the fly" order out, especially that simple. We were shocked that the employee would act out in such a violent way. A manager came said they could refund, etc. we just said we were happy to have paid, just want the sandwich; to then getting attitude from more than one employee. After much bickering and around 40 minutes we got the food and left. The sandwich was just slopped together, barely any cream cheese and just a mess.  Sad to have such a bad experience.

2aQiv0JzUM73_7Ve658huA.text: The Summerlin location might be the best one. While on a shopping spree why not take a break and have some lunch. The wait time was about 6minutes. Not bad compared to other places. I ordered the lavender mimosa- sweet flavor but good taste. My main course-  Lomo Saltado DELICUOUS!! The meat was so soft and juicy. Such a great flavor. I would say it's my favorite plate from this rerestaurant. Great customer service. I even ordered coffee to go lol. This location is more spacious and comfy than the location in downtown. I would definitely be back if im ever in the area again.

z7HjEoj8_E2kNli6OdBRoA.text: This had been a place that I'd saved for a while and figured that I'd check out on my latest trip up to Summerlin. And it was ok, but not good enough for me to want to go back.   Walking into the restaurant/coffee shop, you see how small it is. They do have some outdoor seating, and if I was to go back, I'd strongly recommend that as the inside was walking the line between cozy and cramped. With the open kitchen (usually one of my favorite things) the restaurant smelled strongly of bacon and burnt syrup. We decided to get coffee to go due to the slight wait.   I ordered the lavender fog iced. I didn't really taste the lavender and for once I felt like I wasn't given enough ice as almost all of it was melted before I even walked out the door. The drink was ok, but I ended up only finishing half of it; which is a waste, especially when it cost $5.50. My mom chose the salted caramel latte iced, and strongly recommends stirring the drink well before enjoying as the first sip was mainly salt. She finished her drink, but agreed that it was just ok, and didn't feel it was worth the $5.50.  Ultimately I won't return. There's nothing really pulling me in off the menu, and I feel like I'd have to sit outside to avoid the cramped feeling when it's busy, which would likely require a long wait. Ultimately there's just a lot of options in the same location as this coffee shop, that to me, are worth more of my time and money. I wanted to like this place, but it just wasn't in the cards.

kX930R6kShvz8PpN4DOgmA.text: 3.5 stars, if possible. I met a friend for brunch at Makers & Finders this afternoon and I left with mixed emotions. At face value, this spot is beautifully decorated and glowing with natural light. It's conveniently located in Downtown Summerlin, so it's a bit more accessible for locals when compared to their Main Street location. We were seated promptly and were brought out a carafe of water moments later. After that, it took about ten minutes for a server to stop by our table. It was a bit busy, so I understood this.  I ordered the iced lavender infused latte to drink, and I was seriously impressed. The lavender was subtle, but it still had a strong enough presence to be appreciated.  I paired the latte with the avocado toast. Revoke my Millennial card--this was the first time I've had avocado toast. I was kind of confused by the concept. Is it to be eaten by hand like toast? Cut up like French toast? These are not rhetorical questions. Regardless, I feel like the dish would've benefitted from being topped with sliced or diced tomatoes, as the cherry tomatoes only complicated matters. I was also disappointed because the menu says the egg is served poached, mine seemed to be more soft-boiled in texture. The yolk was much more firm than I'd hoped and expected.  Additionally, the service also left a lot to be desired. I waited about 20 minutes for the check and a to-go cup, despite several attempts to flag down the server. I'm not sure if I'll be back. I love M & F, but I certainly prefer the DTLV location over this one.

uJWjat4NEH9HI9_211E-gA.text: With such high hopes for this place, I really wanted to love it but unfortunately, it fell short for me. I had the cilantro steak salad that comes with a cilantro lime sauce.  My first thought when getting my salad was that it looked as if there was no sauce or dressing however, after taking a bite of the steak with salad, I soon realized that it didn't need much dressing. That said, the dressing didn't stray far from literally just tasting like lime juice "juiced" over my salad. I was also expecting the waiter to ask how I liked my steak cooked, but he didn't, so my steak was cooked WELL-DONE. I guess in part I should have said something, but nonetheless, you would expect it from them. Initially when my salad came out with a freshly cooked steak, it wasn't so hard to eat but as the meat continuously cooled, the steak got harder and harder to eat and eventually I stopped eating because it was just so tough! Also ordered the lavender mimosa, which was recommended by my waiter because I asked for the sweeter option. It was tasty and did the job, but a bit pricey for me coming in at $9 for a little mason jar drink. All in all, I wouldn't return, which is disappointing because I really wanted to love this place as it was such a cute spot to have breakfast/lunch with friends!

82JBbWBwrVXiHpphJxJxiA.text: This place deserves more stars than what it's averaged. The food is absolutely delicious but the space is small so don't come during peak hours and expect a short wait, they get busy as heck and you can tell their vibe isn't about expedient service.   We came for peak lunch time on a Wednesday and we're surprisingly seated right away. We ate here a year ago on our yearly visit to Vegas and remembered it having great coffee and breakfast sandwiches. I'm so glad on this visit we ordered some empanadas filled with short rib. So scrumptious I could have eaten two more. We also got some Yuca Frites and the Parmesan garlic aioli was amazing with it. We ordered two lattes which were delicious and the espresso is VERY strong. I'll ask for one shot next time because the two had me beyond wired for hours.   Service was good and when our server got busy with other tables the manager came by to take our order.

9HJ8tpdMHi41jPpqjMb3Ag.text: I'm sold! Makers and Finders is a favorite of mine and I suggest it to those who have not been or visiting Vegas. There is no shortage of breakfast/ brunch/ lunch places here in Las Vegas but finding one with a nice Latin twist? hmmm... Makers and Finders.  The menu options do have a bit of a healthy Latin twist but they also serve traditional dishes like Lox and Bagels and egg dishes. They also have great vegetarian and vegan options if that  is your jam. I will have to suggest the fries though, which pretty much go with breakfast and lunch! They are crispy and topped with kale which is a nice touch and makes you feel they are a healthy option ;).  There is a nice selection of coffee drinks to suit everyone's tastes.I ordered the  Mexican Spice latte and for those who like a bite at the end, this definitely has a nice bite to it! I tried a bit of the Bon Bon Layered and that was yummy and rich tasting.  This is such a cute place for brunch in Downtown Summerlin! High up there with recommendations!!

lPjxFZaGT-mHE1YG_GTUYw.text: I have walked by this place many times while at the Summerlin plaza which was always consistently busy. After checking the reviews, I knew I needed to try it. My friends and I went on New Years day for Brunch and only had to wait for about 5 minutes before we were seated at a high table. Both the gal who seated us and guy who served us were really nice and made you feel welcome in this cool little place.  First, we placed our orders for drinks which included a very strong and delicious cold brew coffee. Then we ordered a churro waffle to share as an appetizer which was brilliant! I didnt have too much cuz carbs, but every breath I had was just a delight.   I ordered the rib eye with scrambled eggs and potatoes which came in a small skillet. The rib eye was good but a bit fatty. The combination of the eggs potatoes and Rib eye was good but I wouldn't order it again. Everything else was good though which is why they get 4 stars! I will for sure have to come back here and try something else!

Fl4cnlEv25ev5UqtObx6fw.text: Can I just say that it's been over a year since my first check-in here, and I still love this place!  This place has gotten so popular since our very first visit here! I love it! With that being said, expect a wait before being seated even on a WEEKDAY during lunch.  I always order the Smoked Salmon Benedict. IT IS SO GOOD! I especially love that they use this cornbread kind of biscuit. It's a tad sweat and very mosit and it just pairs so well with the kale, poached egg, and the saltiness of the smoked salmon. UGH! SO GOOD. I could literally eat this every morning if I had it my way. My husband always orders the Latin Hash since our very first visit a year ago. So I'd say that that's pretty good. Would be better with a side of rice.  Okay, this time since one of my friends was in a time crunch and the only seating was outside, we sat outside. I honestly like sitting outside because it wasn't too bad for midday during June in Vegas. For some reason, the service was SUPER slow. Not sure if out server was aware that he had been seated, but it did take him a minute after getting our waters to take our order. He seemed kinda irritated, too. Might have been the day. My husband and I gave him the benefit of the doubt because our experience has always been good here and just let it slide.  Still coming back here for brunch as always!

dFZci1Ol_Ycm2KOkodEfug.text: Yum - great food, good coffee, super cute patio and friendly staff - what more could you ask for? There are so many things on the menu that sound delicious, it would take a while to try everything I want! The chicken tinga omelet was well-sized and the chicken was so flavorful and the perfect texture. The chive potatoes are a little plain but go well with all the bursting flavor of the omelet. The turmeric latte is very spiced but that's the expectation with this sort of drink. Loved sitting on the patio in beautiful weather and catching up with friends over good food and coffee and would love to come back for the lunch and dinner menus.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tinga omelet with chive potatoes
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turmeric latte

TY4nLiRSs1zIlTr3zfTneg.text: I've had makers & finders bookmarked on my "must try" list for the longest time. Its location in downtown summerlin made it challenging to finally select for a meal as there are a lot of great options in the area. Unfortunately, after my last lunch experience at Makers & Finders...I left feeling underwhelmed.  As mentioned in other reviews, the dining space is small & you feel cramped in amongst the other guests. The waiting area is small/no existent and added to cramped feeling as more and more people stood around waiting for a table to open up.  Our table was also wobbly, despite having several napkins jammed under the legs. We had to carefully navigate our meal based on this.  Service was extremely slow. Our lunch took nearly 30 minutes longer than intended as we waited for our server to drop off and then pick up the check. I'm glad they left a small water carafe on the table because I can't imagine how they would manage to stay on top of refills.  Food was average. I had the breakfast burger and wasn't really impressed by what I received. The flavor of the burger itself was bland despite its description. Price point also felt a bit too high for what was actually given.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast burger and plantain chips $13

xOCGRc3GpczNTNwTvPmieg.text: I'm a fan!   If you're expecting the typical teas and coffees here, don't! From matchas, lavender tea to a variety of taste bud tickling drinks are what you'll expect.  I've had a good experience with the consumables every time we've been in. The last time we were in I had the lavender tea and a chorizo omelette. Not being huge into omelettes, I was very much impressed! The only thing I don't understand is... As small as the restaurant is, our servers always seem to never be found for our needs. Everyone else's tables are visited, checked on and our table is always left unattended. Safe face.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender Tea w/ cream
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Kombucha had stuff floating around in it... Assumed it needed to be stirred or shaken but when it arrives it shouldn&#39;t look like that.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato Soup... So thick you can eat it with a fork.

_iyjYyEFRmvLrufaUpuRAA.text: Horrible experience!  As I waited for my food I noticed the waiter petting a dog. Without washing his hands, he proceeded to serve food, grab eating utensils, and take orders. After, he still kept petting the dog. I told the manager if she can tell him to wash his hands before bringing my food and she said she would. She also said that he was petting the dog because it was his friend's dog. That is not an excuse! She then approached him and I assume she told him; however, he still didn't wash his hands. I told the manager to please cancel my order and left. She was nice and gave us the coffee for free.   I know some people would not be grossed out by this, but I was!   Also, their seating arrangement in the back is awful. They have tables right by the restroom. So ,if someone takes a crap, u will be smelling it as you eat your food.  Instead, I walked 5 steps from there and ate Skinny Fats; cheaper, cleaner, and faster.

j61dCOZ4PLcNIlBEAOjw6w.text: After many visits to the downtown location, I finally came to this location (which is way closer to my house!) for Sunday brunch.  The place is not very big and it was packed, but we got a table outside on the patio pretty quickly.  The service was great.  The bottomless mimosas kept coming and the food was just as good as their other location.  Love this place!

pCilKudnQt2RvOXywi-jIw.text: Very good service even though server wasn't overly friendly. I got the avocado toast which was basically just toast w guacamole, one egg and a few cherry tomatoes. Didn't really like the sour guacamole but everyone else enjoyed their meals. Both guys got egg and cheese sandwich that they enjoyed. Had to ask for ketchup salt and pepper. Took a while to get drinks. I got a beetroot latte which was perfectly made. I thought the coffee was the best part of the meal. Overall good experience.

v6vlirh9dSDWUep2rhDH6Q.text: Came here for brunch with my girlfriends. They were slammed we waited about 15 mins to get seated which isn't bad.  We ordered lattes coconut turmeric, 2 lavenders & a honey latte all with coconut milk. It took about a good 20mins or so & The coffee came out luke warm... NOT GOOD! But it did taste good i would've been able to enjoy it more if it was hot like what coffee should be.  Coconut & tomatoe bisque soup with grilled cheese the cheese was not melted all the way & the soups were luke warm. (Annoying) We sent it back and they reheated it.   Kale Cesar salad was great! The rest of the food salmon Benedict, empanadas, torta was mediocre. Will i come back? ... yes but only for the latte & kale salad.

kkSphTh7WDmEcoaoeP5lJQ.text: I love Makers and Finders. I was so excited that they opened one in downtown summerlin, so now it's super close to me. My mom and I went here yesterday, I got the Nutella latte and my mom a non fat latte. They both were amazing! I could eat their food everyday too, the empanadas are my all time favorite meal. I will definitely be back. The service is great, the restaurant itself is so clean and well designed!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9j88P8yH43MT-FTgWP0Q8w.text: I was excited to try this place out, but was disappointed.  The food quality is horrible. The empanada sampler was a joke. The empanadas have no filling. They cut the empanadas in half, and half had filling and some did not. The croissant sandwich, same thing, half had the egg, and the other did not.  Sad to say that BurgerKing has a better crossaintWich, for a third of the price. The best part, i guess was the smoked salmon lox, which they are not known for. Food quality has to improve if they want to make it in Summerlin.
